25.english: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

26.hebrew: ††фћ«мћ≈с, о«тјвћ«м ш«вјм∆к»; †† ејл»м-гћјш»л∆йк» йƒлћ…рећ.
26.english: Make plain the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

27.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћ≈и-й»оƒйп ећщ“јо…аем; †† д»с≈ш ш«вјмјк» о≈ш»т.
27.english: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left; remove thy foot from evil. {P}

1.hebrew: בְּנִי, לְחָכְמָתִי הַקְשִׁיבָה;    לִתְבוּנָתִי, הַט-אָזְנֶךָ.
1.english: My son, attend unto my wisdom; incline thine ear to my understanding;

2.hebrew: לִשְׁמֹר מְזִמּוֹת;    וְדַעַת, שְׂפָתֶיךָ יִנְצֹרוּ.
2.english: That thou mayest preserve discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

3.hebrew: כִּי נֹפֶת תִּטֹּפְנָה, שִׂפְתֵי זָרָה;    וְחָלָק מִשֶּׁמֶן חִכָּהּ.
3.english: For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, and her mouth is smoother than oil;

4.hebrew: וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ, מָרָה כַלַּעֲנָה;    חַדָּה, כְּחֶרֶב פִּיּוֹת.
4.english: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.

5.hebrew: רַגְלֶיהָ, יֹרְדוֹת מָוֶת;    שְׁאוֹל, צְעָדֶיהָ יִתְמֹכוּ.
5.english: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on the nether-world;

6.hebrew: אֹרַח חַיִּים, פֶּן-תְּפַלֵּס;    נָעוּ מַעְגְּלֹתֶיהָ, לֹא תֵדָע.
6.english: Lest she should walk the even path of life, her ways wander, but she knoweth it not. {P}

7.hebrew: וְעַתָּה בָנִים, שִׁמְעוּ-לִי;    וְאַל-תָּסוּרוּ, מֵאִמְרֵי-פִי.
7.english: Now therefore, O ye children, hearken unto me, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

8.hebrew: הַרְחֵק מֵעָלֶיהָ דַרְכֶּךָ;    וְאַל-תִּקְרַב, אֶל-פֶּתַח בֵּיתָהּ.
8.english: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house;

9.hebrew: פֶּן-תִּתֵּן לַאֲחֵרִים הוֹדֶךָ;    וּשְׁנֹתֶיךָ, לְאַכְזָרִי.
9.english: Lest thou give thy vigour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel;

10.hebrew: פֶּן-יִשְׂבְּעוּ זָרִים כֹּחֶךָ;    וַעֲצָבֶיךָ, בְּבֵית נָכְרִי.
10.english: Lest strangers be filled with thy strength, and thy labours be in the house of an alien;

11.hebrew: וְנָהַמְתָּ בְאַחֲרִיתֶךָ;    בִּכְלוֹת בְּשָׂרְךָ, וּשְׁאֵרֶךָ.
11.english: And thou moan, when thine end cometh, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

12.hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ--אֵיךְ, שָׂנֵאתִי מוּסָר;    וְתוֹכַחַת, נָאַץ לִבִּי.
12.english: And say: 'How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

13.hebrew: וְלֹא-שָׁמַעְתִּי, בְּקוֹל מוֹרָי;    וְלִמְלַמְּדַי, לֹא-הִטִּיתִי אָזְנִי.
13.english: Neither have I hearkened to the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

14.hebrew: כִּמְעַט, הָיִיתִי בְכָל-רָע--    בְּתוֹךְ קָהָל וְעֵדָה.
14.english: I was well nigh in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.'

15.hebrew: שְׁתֵה-מַיִם מִבּוֹרֶךָ;    וְנֹזְלִים, מִתּוֹךְ בְּאֵרֶךָ.
15.english: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

16.hebrew: יָפוּצוּ מַעְיְנֹתֶיךָ חוּצָה;    בָּרְחֹבוֹת, פַּלְגֵי-מָיִם.
16.english: Let thy springs be dispersed abroad, and courses of water in the streets.

17.hebrew: יִהְיוּ-לְךָ לְבַדֶּךָ;    וְאֵין לְזָרִים אִתָּךְ.
17.english: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.

18.hebrew: יְהִי-מְקוֹרְךָ בָרוּךְ;    וּשְׂמַח, מֵאֵשֶׁת נְעוּרֶךָ.
18.english: Let thy fountain be blessed; and have joy of the wife of thy youth.

19.hebrew: אַיֶּלֶת אֲהָבִים,    וְיַעֲלַת-חֵן:דַּדֶּיהָ, יְרַוֻּךָ בְכָל-עֵת;    בְּאַהֲבָתָהּ, תִּשְׁגֶּה תָמִיד.
19.english: A lovely hind and a graceful doe, {N}let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; with her love be thou ravished always.

20.hebrew: וְלָמָּה תִשְׁגֶּה בְנִי בְזָרָה;    וּתְחַבֵּק, חֵק נָכְרִיָּה.
20.english: Why then wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of an alien?

21.hebrew: כִּי נֹכַח, עֵינֵי יְהוָה--דַּרְכֵי-אִישׁ;    וְכָל-מַעְגְּלֹתָיו מְפַלֵּס.
21.english: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and He maketh even all his paths.

22.hebrew: עֲווֹנֹתָיו--יִלְכְּדֻנוֹ אֶת-הָרָשָׁע;    וּבְחַבְלֵי חַטָּאתוֹ, יִתָּמֵךְ.
22.english: His own iniquities shall ensnare the wicked, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sin.

23.hebrew: הוּא--יָמוּת, בְּאֵין מוּסָר;    וּבְרֹב אִוַּלְתּוֹ יִשְׁגֶּה.
23.english: He shall die for lack of instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall reel. {P}

1.hebrew: בְּנִי, אִם-עָרַבְתָּ לְרֵעֶךָ;    תָּקַעְתָּ לַזָּר כַּפֶּיךָ.
1.english: My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbour, if thou hast struck thy hands for a stranger--

2.hebrew: נוֹקַשְׁתָּ בְאִמְרֵי-פִיךָ;    נִלְכַּדְתָּ, בְּאִמְרֵי-פִיךָ.
2.english: Thou art snared by the words of thy mouth, thou art caught by the words of thy mouth--

3.hebrew: עֲשֵׂה זֹאת אֵפוֹא בְּנִי, וְהִנָּצֵל--    כִּי בָאתָ בְכַף-רֵעֶךָ;לֵךְ הִתְרַפֵּס,    וּרְהַב רֵעֶיךָ.
3.english: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, seeing thou art come into the hand of thy neighbour; {N}go, humble thyself, and urge thy neighbour.

4.hebrew: אַל-תִּתֵּן שֵׁנָה לְעֵינֶיךָ;    וּתְנוּמָה, לְעַפְעַפֶּיךָ.
4.english: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

5.hebrew: הִנָּצֵל, כִּצְבִי מִיָּד;    וּכְצִפּוֹר, מִיַּד יָקוּשׁ.
5.english: Deliver thyself as a gazelle from the hand [of the hunter], and as a bird from the hand of the fowler. {P}

6.hebrew: לֵךְ-אֶל-נְמָלָה עָצֵל;    רְאֵה דְרָכֶיהָ וַחֲכָם.
6.english: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise;

7.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר אֵין-לָהּ קָצִין--    שֹׁטֵר וּמֹשֵׁל.
7.english: Which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,

8.hebrew: תָּכִין בַּקַּיִץ לַחְמָהּ;    אָגְרָה בַקָּצִיר, מַאֲכָלָהּ.
8.english: Provideth her bread in the summer, and gatherest her food in the harvest.

9.hebrew: עַד-מָתַי עָצֵל תִּשְׁכָּב;    מָתַי, תָּקוּם מִשְּׁנָתֶךָ.
9.english: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

10.hebrew: מְעַט שֵׁנוֹת, מְעַט תְּנוּמוֹת;    מְעַט, חִבֻּק יָדַיִם לִשְׁכָּב.
10.english: 'Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep'--

11.hebrew: וּבָא-כִמְהַלֵּךְ רֵאשֶׁךָ;    וּמַחְסֹרְךָ, כְּאִישׁ מָגֵן.
11.english: So shall thy poverty come as a runner, and thy want as an armed man. {P}

12.hebrew: אָדָם בְּלִיַּעַל, אִישׁ אָוֶן;    הוֹלֵךְ, עִקְּשׁוּת פֶּה.
12.english: A base person, a man of iniquity, is he that walketh with a froward mouth;

13.hebrew: קֹרֵץ בְּעֵינָו, מֹלֵל בְּרַגְלָו;    מֹרֶה, בְּאֶצְבְּעֹתָיו.
13.english: That winketh with his eyes, that scrapeth with his feet, that pointeth with his fingers;

14.hebrew: תַּהְפֻּכוֹת, בְּלִבּוֹ--חֹרֵשׁ רָע בְּכָל-עֵת;    מדנים (מִדְיָנִים) יְשַׁלֵּחַ.
14.english: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth evil continually; he soweth discord.

15.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן--פִּתְאֹם, יָבוֹא אֵידוֹ;    פֶּתַע יִשָּׁבֵר, וְאֵין מַרְפֵּא.
15.english: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; on a sudden shall he be broken, and that without remedy. {P}

16.hebrew: שֶׁשׁ-הֵנָּה, שָׂנֵא יְהוָה;    וְשֶׁבַע, תועבות (תּוֹעֲבַת) נַפְשׁוֹ.
16.english: There are six things which the LORD hateth, yea, seven which are an abomination unto Him:

17.hebrew: עֵינַיִם רָמוֹת, לְשׁוֹן שָׁקֶר;    וְיָדַיִם, שֹׁפְכוֹת דָּם-נָקִי.
17.english: Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood;

18.hebrew: לֵב--חֹרֵשׁ, מַחְשְׁבוֹת אָוֶן;    רַגְלַיִם מְמַהֲרוֹת, לָרוּץ לָרָעָה.
18.english: A heart that deviseth wicked thoughts, feet that are swift in running to evil;

19.hebrew: יָפִיחַ כְּזָבִים, עֵד שָׁקֶר;    וּמְשַׁלֵּחַ מְדָנִים, בֵּין אַחִים.
19.english: A false witness that breatheth out lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren. {P}

20.hebrew: נְצֹר בְּנִי, מִצְוַת אָבִיךָ;    וְאַל-תִּטֹּשׁ, תּוֹרַת אִמֶּךָ.
20.english: My son, keep the commandment of thy father, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;

21.hebrew: קָשְׁרֵם עַל-לִבְּךָ תָמִיד;    עָנְדֵם, עַל-גַּרְגְּרֹתֶךָ.
21.english: Bind them continually upon thy heart, tie them about thy neck.

22.hebrew: בְּהִתְהַלֶּכְךָ, תַּנְחֶה אֹתָךְ--    בְּשָׁכְבְּךָ, תִּשְׁמֹר עָלֶיךָ;וַהֲקִיצוֹתָ,    הִיא תְשִׂיחֶךָ.
22.english: When thou walkest, it shall lead thee, when thou liest down, it shall watch over thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

23.hebrew: כִּי נֵר מִצְוָה, וְתוֹרָה אוֹר;    וְדֶרֶךְ חַיִּים, תּוֹכְחוֹת מוּסָר.
23.english: For the commandment is a lamp, and the teaching is light, and reproofs of instruction are the way of life;

24.hebrew: לִשְׁמָרְךָ, מֵאֵשֶׁת רָע;    מֵחֶלְקַת, לָשׁוֹן נָכְרִיָּה.
24.english: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the smoothness of the alien tongue.

25.hebrew: אַל-תַּחְמֹד יָפְיָהּ, בִּלְבָבֶךָ;    וְאַל-תִּקָּחֲךָ, בְּעַפְעַפֶּיהָ.
25.english: Lust not after her beauty in thy heart; neither let her captivate thee with her eyelids.

26.hebrew: כִּי בְעַד-אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה,    עַד-כִּכַּר-לָחֶם:וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ--    נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד.
26.english: For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread, but the adulteress hunteth for the precious life. {P}

27.hebrew: הֲיַחְתֶּה אִישׁ אֵשׁ בְּחֵיקוֹ;    וּבְגָדָיו, לֹא תִשָּׂרַפְנָה.
27.english: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

28.hebrew: אִם-יְהַלֵּךְ אִישׁ, עַל-הַגֶּחָלִים;    וְרַגְלָיו, לֹא תִכָּוֶינָה.
28.english: Or can one walk upon hot coals, and his feet not be scorched?

29.hebrew: כֵּן--הַבָּא, אֶל-אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ:    לֹא-יִנָּקֶה, כָּל-הַנֹּגֵעַ בָּהּ.
29.english: So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not go unpunished.

30.hebrew: לֹא-יָבוּזוּ לַגַּנָּב, כִּי יִגְנוֹב--    לְמַלֵּא נַפְשׁוֹ, כִּי יִרְעָב.
30.english: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

31.hebrew: וְנִמְצָא, יְשַׁלֵּם שִׁבְעָתָיִם:    אֶת-כָּל-הוֹן בֵּיתוֹ יִתֵּן.
31.english: But if he be found, he must restore sevenfold, he must give all the substance of his house.

32.hebrew: נֹאֵף אִשָּׁה חֲסַר-לֵב;    מַשְׁחִית נַפְשׁוֹ, הוּא יַעֲשֶׂנָּה.
32.english: He that committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding; he doeth it that would destroy his own soul.

33.english: Wounds and dishonour shall he get, and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

34.english: For jealousy is the rage of a man, and he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

35.hebrew: לֹא-יִשָּׂא, פְּנֵי כָל-כֹּפֶר;    וְלֹא-יֹאבֶה, כִּי תַרְבֶּה-שֹּׁחַד.
35.english: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts. {P}

8.english: Passing through the street near her corner, and he went the way to her house;

9.hebrew: áÌÀğÆùÑÆó-áÌÀòÆøÆá éåÉí;    áÌÀàÄéùÑåÉï ìÇéÀìÈä, åÇàÂôÅìÈä.
9.english: In the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the blackness of night and the darkness.

10.hebrew: åÀäÄğÌÅä àÄùÌÑÈä, ìÄ÷ÀøÈàúåÉ;    ùÑÄéú æåÉğÈä, åÌğÀöËøÇú ìÅá.
10.english: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of a harlot, and wily of heart.

11.hebrew: äÉîÄéÌÈä äÄéà åÀñÉøÈøÆú;    áÌÀáÅéúÈäÌ, ìÉà-éÄùÑÀëÌÀğåÌ øÇâÀìÆéäÈ.
11.english: She is riotous and rebellious, her feet abide not in her house;

12.hebrew: ôÌÇòÇí, áÌÇçåÌõ--ôÌÇòÇí áÌÈøÀçÉáåÉú;    åÀàÅöÆì ëÌÈì-ôÌÄğÌÈä úÆàÁøÉá.
12.english: Now she is in the streets, now in the broad places, and lieth in wait at every corner.

13.hebrew: åÀäÆçÁæÄé÷Èä áÌåÉ, åÀğÈùÑÀ÷Èä ìÌåÉ;    äÅòÅæÈä ôÈğÆéäÈ, åÇúÌÉàîÇø ìåÉ.
13.english: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face she said unto him:

14.hebrew: æÄáÀçÅé ùÑÀìÈîÄéí òÈìÈé;    äÇéÌåÉí, ùÑÄìÌÇîÀúÌÄé ğÀãÈøÈé.
14.english: 'Sacrifices of peace-offerings were due from me; this day have I paid my vows.

15.hebrew: òÇì-ëÌÅï, éÈöÈàúÄé ìÄ÷ÀøÈàúÆêÈ;    ìÀùÑÇçÅø ôÌÈğÆéêÈ, åÈàÆîÀöÈàÆêÌÈ.
15.english: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

16.hebrew: îÇøÀáÇãÌÄéí, øÈáÇãÀúÌÄé òÇøÀùÒÄé;    çÂèËáåÉú, àÅèåÌï îÄöÀøÈéÄí.
16.english: I have decked my couch with coverlets, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.

17.hebrew: ğÇôÀúÌÄé îÄùÑÀëÌÈáÄé--    îÉø àÂäÈìÄéí, åÀ÷ÄğÌÈîåÉï.
17.english: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.hebrew: ìÀëÈä ğÄøÀåÆä ãÉãÄéí, òÇã-äÇáÌÉ÷Æø;    ğÄúÀòÇìÌÀñÈä, áÌÈàÃäÈáÄéí.
18.english: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning; let us solace ourselves with loves.

19.hebrew: ëÌÄé àÅéï äÈàÄéùÑ áÌÀáÅéúåÉ;    äÈìÇêÀ, áÌÀãÆøÆêÀ îÅøÈçåÉ÷.
19.english: For my husband is not at home, he is gone a long journey;

20.hebrew: öÀøåÉø-äÇëÌÆñÆó, ìÈ÷Çç áÌÀéÈãåÉ;    ìÀéåÉí äÇëÌÅñÆà, éÈáÉà áÅéúåÉ.
20.english: He hath taken the bag of money with him; he will come home at the full moon.'

21.hebrew: äÄèÌÇúÌåÌ, áÌÀøÉá ìÄ÷ÀçÈäÌ;    áÌÀçÅìÆ÷ ùÒÀôÈúÆéäÈ, úÌÇãÌÄéçÆğÌåÌ.
21.english: With her much fair speech she causeth him to yield, with the blandishment of her lips she enticeth him away.

22.hebrew: äåÉìÅêÀ àÇçÂøÆéäÈ, ôÌÄúÀàÉí:    ëÌÀùÑåÉø, àÆì-èÆáÇç éÈáÉà; åÌëÀòÆëÆñ, àÆì-îåÌñÇø àÁåÄéì.
22.english: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox that goeth to the slaughter, or as one in fetters to the correction of the fool;

23.hebrew: òÇã éÀôÇìÌÇç çÅõ, ëÌÀáÅãåÉ--    ëÌÀîÇäÅø öÄôÌåÉø àÆì-ôÌÈç;åÀìÉà-éÈãÇò,    ëÌÄé-áÀğÇôÀùÑåÉ äåÌà.
23.english: Till an arrow strike through his liver; as a bird hasteneth to the snare-- {N}and knoweth not that it is at the cost of his life.

24.hebrew: åÀòÇúÌÈä áÈğÄéí, ùÑÄîÀòåÌ-ìÄé;    åÀäÇ÷ÀùÑÄéáåÌ, ìÀàÄîÀøÅé-ôÄé.
24.english: Now therefore, O ye children, hearken unto me, and attend to the words of my mouth.

25.hebrew: àÇì-éÅùÒÀèÀ àÆì-ãÌÀøÈëÆéäÈ ìÄáÌÆêÈ;    àÇì-úÌÅúÇò, áÌÄğÀúÄéáåÉúÆéäÈ.
25.english: Let not thy heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

26.hebrew: ëÌÄé-øÇáÌÄéí çÂìÈìÄéí äÄôÌÄéìÈä;    åÇòÂöËîÄéí, ëÌÈì-äÂøËâÆéäÈ.
26.english: For she hath cast down many wounded; yea, a mighty host are all her slain.

27.hebrew: ãÌÇøÀëÅé ùÑÀàåÉì áÌÅéúÈäÌ;    éÉøÀãåÉú, àÆì-çÇãÀøÅé-îÈåÆú.
27.english: Her house is the way to the nether-world, going down to the chambers of death. {P}

1.hebrew: הֲלֹא-חָכְמָה תִקְרָא;    וּתְבוּנָה, תִּתֵּן קוֹלָהּ.
1.english: Doth not wisdom call, and understanding put forth her voice?

2.hebrew: בְּרֹאשׁ-מְרֹמִים עֲלֵי-דָרֶךְ;    בֵּית נְתִיבוֹת נִצָּבָה.
2.english: In the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she standeth;

3.hebrew: לְיַד-שְׁעָרִים לְפִי-קָרֶת;    מְבוֹא פְתָחִים תָּרֹנָּה.
3.english: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud:

4.hebrew: אֲלֵיכֶם אִישִׁים אֶקְרָא;    וְקוֹלִי, אֶל-בְּנֵי אָדָם.
4.english: 'Unto you, O men, I call, and my voice is to the sons of men.

5.hebrew: הָבִינוּ פְתָאיִם עָרְמָה;    וּכְסִילִים, הָבִינוּ לֵב.
5.english: O ye thoughtless, understand prudence, and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

6.hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ, כִּי-נְגִידִים אֲדַבֵּר;    וּמִפְתַּח שְׂפָתַי, מֵישָׁרִים.
6.english: Hear, for I will speak excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

7.hebrew: כִּי-אֱמֶת, יֶהְגֶּה חִכִּי;    וְתוֹעֲבַת שְׂפָתַי רֶשַׁע.
7.english: For my mouth shall utter truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

8.hebrew: בְּצֶדֶק כָּל-אִמְרֵי-פִי:    אֵין בָּהֶם, נִפְתָּל וְעִקֵּשׁ.
8.english: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness, there is nothing perverse or crooked in them.

9.hebrew: כֻּלָּם נְכֹחִים, לַמֵּבִין;    וִישָׁרִים, לְמֹצְאֵי דָעַת.
9.english: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

10.hebrew: קְחוּ-מוּסָרִי וְאַל-כָּסֶף;    וְדַעַת, מֵחָרוּץ נִבְחָר.
10.english: Receive my instruction, and not silver, and knowledge rather than choice gold.

11.hebrew: כִּי-טוֹבָה חָכְמָה, מִפְּנִינִים;    וְכָל-חֲפָצִים, לֹא יִשְׁווּ-בָהּ.
11.english: For wisdom is better than rubies, and all things desirable are not to be compared unto her.

12.hebrew: אֲנִי-חָכְמָה, שָׁכַנְתִּי עָרְמָה;    וְדַעַת מְזִמּוֹת אֶמְצָא.
12.english: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of devices.

13.hebrew: יִרְאַת יְהוָה,    שְׂנֹאת-רָע:גֵּאָה וְגָאוֹן וְדֶרֶךְ רָע, וּפִי תַהְפֻּכוֹת    שָׂנֵאתִי.
13.english: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil; {N}pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

14.hebrew: לִי-עֵצָה, וְתוּשִׁיָּה;    אֲנִי בִינָה, לִי גְבוּרָה.
14.english: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom; I am understanding, power is mine.

15.hebrew: בִּי, מְלָכִים יִמְלֹכוּ;    וְרֹזְנִים, יְחֹקְקוּ צֶדֶק.
15.english: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

16.hebrew: בִּי, שָׂרִים יָשֹׂרוּ;    וּנְדִיבִים, כָּל-שֹׁפְטֵי צֶדֶק.
16.english: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

17.hebrew: אֲנִי, אהביה (אֹהֲבַי) אֵהָב;    וּמְשַׁחֲרַי, יִמְצָאֻנְנִי.
17.english: I love them that love me, and those that seek me earnestly shall find me.

18.hebrew: עֹשֶׁר-וְכָבוֹד אִתִּי;    הוֹן עָתֵק, וּצְדָקָה.
18.english: Riches and honour are with me; yea, enduring riches and righteousness.

19.hebrew: טוֹב פִּרְיִי, מֵחָרוּץ וּמִפָּז;    וּתְבוּאָתִי, מִכֶּסֶף נִבְחָר.
19.english: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my produce than choice silver.

20.hebrew: בְּאֹרַח-צְדָקָה אֲהַלֵּךְ;    בְּתוֹךְ, נְתִיבוֹת מִשְׁפָּט.
20.english: I walk in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice;

21.hebrew: לְהַנְחִיל אֹהֲבַי יֵשׁ;    וְאֹצְרֹתֵיהֶם אֲמַלֵּא.
21.english: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, and that I may fill their treasuries.

22.hebrew: יְהוָה--קָנָנִי, רֵאשִׁית דַּרְכּוֹ:    קֶדֶם מִפְעָלָיו מֵאָז.
22.english: The LORD made me as the beginning of His way, the first of His works of old.

23.hebrew: מֵעוֹלָם, נִסַּכְתִּי מֵרֹאשׁ--    מִקַּדְמֵי-אָרֶץ.
23.english: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

24.hebrew: בְּאֵין-תְּהֹמוֹת חוֹלָלְתִּי;    בְּאֵין מַעְיָנוֹת, נִכְבַּדֵּי-מָיִם.
24.english: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.

25.hebrew: בְּטֶרֶם הָרִים הָטְבָּעוּ;    לִפְנֵי גְבָעוֹת חוֹלָלְתִּי.
25.english: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth;

26.hebrew: עַד-לֹא עָשָׂה, אֶרֶץ וְחוּצוֹת;    וְרֹאשׁ, עַפְרוֹת תֵּבֵל.
26.english: While as yet He had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.

27.hebrew: בַּהֲכִינוֹ שָׁמַיִם, שָׁם אָנִי;    בְּחֻקוֹ חוּג, עַל-פְּנֵי תְהוֹם.
27.english: When He established the heavens, I was there; when He set a circle upon the face of the deep,

28.hebrew: בְּאַמְּצוֹ שְׁחָקִים מִמָּעַל;    בַּעֲזוֹז, עִינוֹת תְּהוֹם.
28.english: When He made firm the skies above, when the fountains of the deep showed their might,

29.hebrew: בְּשׂוּמוֹ לַיָּם, חֻקּוֹ, וּמַיִם, לֹא יַעַבְרוּ-פִיו;    בְּחוּקוֹ, מוֹסְדֵי אָרֶץ.
29.english: When He gave to the sea His decree, that the waters should not transgress His commandment, when He appointed the foundations of the earth;

30.hebrew: וָאֶהְיֶה אֶצְלוֹ, אָמוֹן:    וָאֶהְיֶה שַׁעֲשׁוּעִים, יוֹם יוֹם; מְשַׂחֶקֶת לְפָנָיו בְּכָל-עֵת.
30.english: Then I was by Him, as a nursling; and I was daily all delight, playing always before Him,

31.hebrew: מְשַׂחֶקֶת, בְּתֵבֵל אַרְצוֹ;    וְשַׁעֲשֻׁעַי, אֶת-בְּנֵי אָדָם.
31.english: Playing in His habitable earth, and my delights are with the sons of men. {P}

32.hebrew: וְעַתָּה בָנִים, שִׁמְעוּ-לִי;    וְאַשְׁרֵי, דְּרָכַי יִשְׁמֹרוּ.
32.english: Now therefore, ye children, hearken unto me; for happy are they that keep my ways.

33.english: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

34.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם, שֹׁמֵעַ-לִי:    לִשְׁקֹד עַל-דַּלְתֹתַי, יוֹם יוֹם--לִשְׁמֹר, מְזוּזֹת פְּתָחָי.
34.english: Happy is the man that hearkeneth to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

35.hebrew: כִּי מֹצְאִי, מצאי (מָצָא) חַיִּים;    וַיָּפֶק רָצוֹן, מֵיְהוָה.
35.english: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.

36.hebrew: וְחֹטְאִי, חֹמֵס נַפְשׁוֹ;    כָּל-מְשַׂנְאַי, אָהֲבוּ מָוֶת.
36.english: But he that misseth me wrongeth his own soul; all they that hate me love death.'

1.hebrew: חָכְמוֹת, בָּנְתָה בֵיתָהּ;    חָצְבָה עַמּוּדֶיהָ שִׁבְעָה.
1.english: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars;

2.hebrew: טָבְחָה טִבְחָהּ, מָסְכָה יֵינָהּ;    אַף, עָרְכָה שֻׁלְחָנָהּ.
2.english: She hath prepared her meat, she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

3.hebrew: שָׁלְחָה נַעֲרֹתֶיהָ תִקְרָא--    עַל-גַּפֵּי, מְרֹמֵי קָרֶת.
3.english: She hath sent forth her maidens, she calleth, upon the highest places of the city:

4.hebrew: מִי-פֶתִי, יָסֻר הֵנָּה;    חֲסַר-לֵב, אָמְרָה לּוֹ.
4.english: 'Whoso is thoughtless, let him turn in hither'; as for him that lacketh understanding, she saith to him:

5.hebrew: לְכוּ, לַחֲמוּ בְלַחֲמִי;    וּשְׁתוּ, בְּיַיִן מָסָכְתִּי.
5.english: 'Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

6.hebrew: עִזְבוּ פְתָאיִם וִחְיוּ;    וְאִשְׁרוּ, בְּדֶרֶךְ בִּינָה.
6.english: Forsake all thoughtlessness, and live; and walk in the way of understanding.

7.hebrew: יֹסֵר, לֵץ--לֹקֵחַ לוֹ קָלוֹן;    וּמוֹכִיחַ לְרָשָׁע מוּמוֹ.
7.english: He that correcteth a scorner getteth to himself shame, and he that reproveth a wicked man, it becometh unto him a blot.

8.hebrew: אַל-תּוֹכַח לֵץ, פֶּן-יִשְׂנָאֶךָּ;    הוֹכַח לְחָכָם, וְיֶאֱהָבֶךָּ.
8.english: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee; reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.

9.hebrew: תֵּן לְחָכָם, וְיֶחְכַּם-עוֹד;    הוֹדַע לְצַדִּיק, וְיוֹסֶף לֶקַח.
9.english: Give to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser; teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.

10.hebrew: תְּחִלַּת חָכְמָה, יִרְאַת יְהוָה;    וְדַעַת קְדֹשִׁים בִּינָה.
10.english: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the All-holy is understanding.

11.hebrew: כִּי-בִי, יִרְבּוּ יָמֶיךָ;    וְיוֹסִיפוּ לְּךָ, שְׁנוֹת חַיִּים.
11.english: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

12.hebrew: אִם-חָכַמְתָּ, חָכַמְתָּ לָּךְ;    וְלַצְתָּ, לְבַדְּךָ תִשָּׂא.
12.english: If thou art wise, thou art wise for thyself; and if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.'

13.hebrew: אֵשֶׁת כְּסִילוּת, הֹמִיָּה;    פְּתַיּוּת, וּבַל-יָדְעָה מָּה.
13.english: The woman Folly is riotous; she is thoughtless, and knoweth nothing.

14.hebrew: וְיָשְׁבָה, לְפֶתַח בֵּיתָהּ--    עַל-כִּסֵּא, מְרֹמֵי קָרֶת.
14.english: And she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

15.hebrew: לִקְרֹא לְעֹבְרֵי-דָרֶךְ;    הַמְיַשְּׁרִים, אֹרְחוֹתָם.
15.english: To call to them that pass by, who go right on their ways:

16.hebrew: מִי-פֶתִי, יָסֻר הֵנָּה;    וַחֲסַר-לֵב, וְאָמְרָה לּוֹ.
16.english: 'Whoso is thoughtless, let him turn in hither'; and as for him that lacketh understanding, she saith to him:

17.hebrew: מַיִם-גְּנוּבִים יִמְתָּקוּ;    וְלֶחֶם סְתָרִים יִנְעָם.
17.english: 'Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.'

18.hebrew: וְלֹא-יָדַע, כִּי-רְפָאִים שָׁם;    בְּעִמְקֵי שְׁאוֹל קְרֻאֶיהָ.
18.english: But he knoweth not that the shades are there; that her guests are in the depths of the nether-world.

1.hebrew: †† †† †† †† †† †† оƒщ—јм≈й, щ—јм…о…д:бћ≈п з»л»н, йјщ“«оћ«з-а»б; †† ећб≈п лћјсƒйм, ъћећв«ъ аƒоће….
1.english: {S} The proverbs of Solomon. {N}A wise son maketh a glad father; but a foolish son is the grief of his mother.

2.hebrew: ††м…а-йе…тƒймећ, ае…цјше…ъ ш∆щ—«т; †† ећцјг»ч»д, ъћ«цћƒйм оƒоћ»е∆ъ.

5.english: A wise son gathereth in summer; but a son that doeth shamefully sleepeth in harvest.

6.hebrew: ††бћјш»ле…ъ, мјш…ащ— ц«гћƒйч; †† ећфƒй шјщ—»тƒйн, йјл«сћ∆д з»о»с.

7.english: The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing; but the name of the wicked shall rot.

8.hebrew: ††з¬л«н-м≈б, йƒчћ«з оƒцје ъ; †† е∆аЅеƒйм щ“јф»ъ«йƒн, йƒмћ»б≈и.
8.english: The wise in heart will receive commandments; but a prating fool shall fall.

9.hebrew: ††де…м≈кј бћ«ъћ…н, й≈м∆кј бћ∆и«з; †† ећојт«чћ≈щ— гћјш»л»йе, йƒећ»г≈т«.
9.english: He that walketh uprightly walketh securely; but he that perverteth his ways shall be found out.

10.hebrew: ††ч…ш≈х т«йƒп, йƒъћ≈п т«цћ»б∆ъ; †† е∆аЅеƒйм щ“јф»ъ«йƒн, йƒмћ»б≈и.
10.english: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow; and a prating fool shall fall.

11.hebrew: ††ојче…ш з«йћƒйн, фћƒй ц«гћƒйч; †† ећфƒй шјщ—»тƒйн, йјл«сћ∆д з»о»с.
11.english: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life; but the mouth of the wicked concealeth violence.

12.hebrew: ††щ“ƒрја»д, ъћјт…ш≈ш ојг»рƒйн; †† ејт«м лћ»м-фћјщ—»тƒйн, ъћјл«сћ∆д а«д¬б»д.
12.english: Hatred stirreth up strifes; but love covereth all transgressions.

13.hebrew: ††бћјщ“ƒфјъ≈й р»бе…п, ъћƒоћ»ц≈а з»лјо»д; †† ејщ—≈б∆и, мјв≈е з¬с«ш-м≈б.
13.english: In the lips of him that hath discernment wisdom is found; but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

14.english: Wise men lay up knowledge; but the mouth of the foolish is an imminent ruin.

15.hebrew: ††де…п т»щ—ƒйш, чƒшјй«ъ тЋжће…; †† ојзƒъћ«ъ гћ«мћƒйн ш≈йщ—»н.
15.english: The rich man's wealth is his strong city; the ruin of the poor is their poverty.

16.hebrew: ††фћјтЋмћ«ъ ц«гћƒйч мјз«йћƒйн; †† ъћјбећа«ъ ш»щ—»т мјз«ић»аъ.
16.english: The wages of the righteous is life; the increase of the wicked is sin.

17.hebrew: ††а…ш«з мјз«йћƒйн, щ—е…о≈ш оећс»ш; †† ејт…ж≈б ъће…л«з«ъ о«ъјт∆д.
17.english: He is in the way of life that heedeth instruction; but he that forsaketh reproof erreth.

18.hebrew: ††ојл«сћ∆д щ“ƒрја»д, щ“ƒфјъ≈й-щ—»ч∆ш; †† ећое…цƒа гƒбћ»д, дећа лјсƒйм.
18.english: He that hideth hatred is of lying lips; and he that uttereth a slander is a fool.

19.hebrew: ††бћјш…б гћјб»шƒйн, м…а й∆зјгћ«м-фћ»щ—«т; †† ејзе…щ“≈кј щ“јф»ъ»йе о«щ“јлћƒйм.
19.english: In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression; but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

20.hebrew: ††лћ∆с∆у рƒбјз»ш, мјщ—е…п ц«гћƒйч; †† м≈б шјщ—»тƒйн лћƒојт»и.
20.english: The tongue of the righteous is as choice silver; the heart of the wicked is little worth.

21.hebrew: ††щ“ƒфјъ≈й ц«гћƒйч, йƒшјтећ ш«бћƒйн; †† е∆аЅеƒймƒйн, бћ«з¬с«ш-м≈б й»оећъећ.
21.english: The lips of the righteous feed many; but the foolish die for want of understanding.

22.hebrew: ††бћƒшјлћ«ъ йјде»д, дƒйа ъ«т¬щ—ƒйш; †† ејм…а-йе…сƒу т∆ц∆б тƒоћ»дћ.
22.english: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and toil addeth nothing thereto.

23.hebrew: ††лћƒщ“јзе…ч мƒлјсƒйм, т¬щ“е…ъ жƒоћ»д; †† ејз»лјо»д, мјаƒйщ— ъћјбећр»д.
23.english: It is as sport to a fool to do wickedness, and so is wisdom to a man of discernment.

24.hebrew: ††ојве…ш«ъ ш»щ—»т, дƒйа ъјбе…а∆рћећ; †† ејъ«а¬е«ъ ц«гћƒйчƒйн йƒъћ≈п.
24.english: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him; and the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

25.hebrew: ††лћ«т¬бе…ш сећф»д, еја≈йп ш»щ—»т; †† ејц«гћƒйч, йјсе…г те…м»н.
25.english: When the whirlwind passeth, the wicked is no more; but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

26.hebrew: ††лћ«з…о∆х, м«щћ—ƒрћ«йƒн--ејл∆т»щ—»п м»т≈йр»йƒн: †† лћ≈п д∆т»ц≈м, мјщ—…мјз»йе.
26.english: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

27.hebrew: ††йƒшја«ъ йјде»д, ъће…сƒйу й»оƒйн; †† ећщ—јре…ъ шјщ—»тƒйн ъћƒчјц…шјр»д.
27.english: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days; but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

28.hebrew: ††ъће…з∆м∆ъ ц«гћƒйчƒйн щ“ƒојз»д; †† ејъƒчје«ъ шјщ—»тƒйн ъћ…аб≈г.
28.english: The hope of the righteous is gladness; but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

29.hebrew: ††о»те…ж м«ъћ…н, гћ∆ш∆кј йјде»д; †† ећојзƒъћ»д, мјф…т¬м≈й а»е∆п.
29.english: The way of the LORD is a stronghold to the upright, but ruin to the workers of iniquity.

30.english: The righteous shall never be moved; but the wicked shall not inhabit the land.

31.english: The mouth of the righteous buddeth with wisdom; but the froward tongue shall be cut off.

32.hebrew: ††щ“ƒфјъ≈й ц«гћƒйч, й≈гјтећп ш»це…п; †† ећфƒй шјщ—»тƒйн, ъћ«дјфћЋле…ъ.
32.english: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable; but the mouth of the wicked is all frowardness.

1.hebrew: מֹאזְנֵי מִרְמָה, תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה;    וְאֶבֶן שְׁלֵמָה רְצוֹנוֹ.
1.english: A false balance is an abomination to the LORD; but a perfect weight is His delight.

2.hebrew: בָּא-זָדוֹן, וַיָּבֹא קָלוֹן;    וְאֶת-צְנוּעִים חָכְמָה.
2.english: When pride cometh, then cometh shame; but with the lowly is wisdom.

3.hebrew: תֻּמַּת יְשָׁרִים תַּנְחֵם;    וְסֶלֶף בֹּגְדִים ושדם (יְשָׁדֵּם).
3.english: The integrity of the upright shall guide them; but the perverseness of the faithless shall destroy them.

4.hebrew: לֹא-יוֹעִיל הוֹן, בְּיוֹם עֶבְרָה;    וּצְדָקָה, תַּצִּיל מִמָּוֶת.
4.english: Riches profit not in the day of wrath; but righteousness delivereth from death.

5.hebrew: צִדְקַת תָּמִים, תְּיַשֵּׁר דַּרְכּוֹ;    וּבְרִשְׁעָתוֹ, יִפֹּל רָשָׁע.
5.english: The righteousness of the sincere shall make straight his way; but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

6.hebrew: צִדְקַת יְשָׁרִים, תַּצִּילֵם;    וּבְהַוַּת, בֹּגְדִים יִלָּכֵדוּ.
6.english: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them; but the faithless shall be trapped in their own crafty device.

7.hebrew: בְּמוֹת אָדָם רָשָׁע, תֹּאבַד תִּקְוָה;    וְתוֹחֶלֶת אוֹנִים אָבָדָה.
7.english: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish, and the hope of strength perisheth.

8.hebrew: צַדִּיק, מִצָּרָה נֶחֱלָץ;    וַיָּבֹא רָשָׁע תַּחְתָּיו.
8.english: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.

9.hebrew: בְּפֶה--חָנֵף, יַשְׁחִת רֵעֵהוּ;    וּבְדַעַת, צַדִּיקִים יֵחָלֵצוּ.
9.english: With his mouth the impious man destroyeth his neighbour; but through knowledge shall the righteous be delivered.

10.hebrew: בְּטוּב צַדִּיקִים, תַּעֲלֹץ קִרְיָה;    וּבַאֲבֹד רְשָׁעִים רִנָּה.
10.english: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; and when the wicked perish, there is joy.

11.hebrew: בְּבִרְכַּת יְשָׁרִים, תָּרוּם קָרֶת;    וּבְפִי רְשָׁעִים, תֵּהָרֵס.
11.english: By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted; but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

12.hebrew: בָּז-לְרֵעֵהוּ חֲסַר-לֵב;    וְאִישׁ תְּבוּנוֹת יַחֲרִישׁ.
12.english: He that despiseth his neighbour lacketh understanding; but a man of discernment holdeth his peace.

13.hebrew: הוֹלֵךְ רָכִיל, מְגַלֶּה-סּוֹד;    וְנֶאֱמַן-רוּחַ, מְכַסֶּה דָבָר.
13.english: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth a matter.

14.hebrew: בְּאֵין תַּחְבֻּלוֹת, יִפָּל-עָם;    וּתְשׁוּעָה, בְּרֹב יוֹעֵץ.
14.english: Where no wise direction is, a people falleth; but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

15.hebrew: רַע-יֵרוֹעַ, כִּי-עָרַב זָר;    וְשֹׂנֵא תֹקְעִים בּוֹטֵחַ.
15.english: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it; but he that hateth them that strike hands is secure.

16.hebrew: אֵשֶׁת-חֵן, תִּתְמֹךְ כָּבוֹד;    וְעָרִיצִים, יִתְמְכוּ-עֹשֶׁר.
16.english: A gracious woman obtaineth honour; and strong men obtain riches.

17.hebrew: גֹּמֵל נַפְשׁוֹ, אִישׁ חָסֶד;    וְעֹכֵר שְׁאֵרוֹ, אַכְזָרִי.
17.english: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul; but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.

18.hebrew: רָשָׁע--עֹשֶׂה פְעֻלַּת-שָׁקֶר;    וְזֹרֵעַ צְדָקָה, שֶׂכֶר אֱמֶת.
18.english: The wicked earneth deceitful wages; but he that soweth righteousness hath a sure reward.

19.hebrew: כֵּן-צְדָקָה לְחַיִּים;    וּמְרַדֵּף רָעָה לְמוֹתוֹ.
19.english: Stedfast righteousness tendeth to life; but he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.

20.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה, עִקְּשֵׁי-לֵב;    וּרְצוֹנוֹ, תְּמִימֵי דָרֶךְ.
20.english: They that are perverse in heart are an abomination to the LORD; but such as are upright in their way are His delight.

21.hebrew: יָד לְיָד, לֹא-יִנָּקֶה רָּע;    וְזֶרַע צַדִּיקִים נִמְלָט.
21.english: My hand upon it! the evil man shall not be unpunished; but the seed of the righteous shall escape.

22.hebrew: נֶזֶם זָהָב, בְּאַף חֲזִיר--    אִשָּׁה יָפָה, וְסָרַת טָעַם.
22.english: As a ring of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman that turneth aside from discretion.

23.hebrew: תַּאֲוַת צַדִּיקִים אַךְ-טוֹב;    תִּקְוַת רְשָׁעִים עֶבְרָה.
23.english: The desire of the righteous is only good; but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

24.hebrew: יֵשׁ מְפַזֵּר, וְנוֹסָף עוֹד;    וְחֹשֵׂךְ מִיֹּשֶׁר, אַךְ-לְמַחְסוֹר.
24.english: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth only to want.

25.hebrew: נֶפֶשׁ-בְּרָכָה תְדֻשָּׁן;    וּמַרְוֶה, גַּם-הוּא יוֹרֶא.
25.english: The beneficent soul shall be made rich, and he that satisfieth abundantly shall be satisfied also himself.

26.hebrew: מֹנֵעַ בָּר, יִקְּבֻהוּ לְאוֹם;    וּבְרָכָה, לְרֹאשׁ מַשְׁבִּיר.
26.english: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him; but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

27.hebrew: שֹׁחֵר טוֹב, יְבַקֵּשׁ רָצוֹן;    וְדֹרֵשׁ רָעָה תְבוֹאֶנּוּ.
27.english: He that diligently seeketh good seeketh favour; but he that searcheth for evil, it shall come unto him.

28.hebrew: בּוֹטֵחַ בְּעָשְׁרוֹ, הוּא יִפּוֹל;    וְכֶעָלֶה, צַדִּיקִים יִפְרָחוּ.
28.english: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as foliage.

29.hebrew: עֹכֵר בֵּיתוֹ, יִנְחַל-רוּחַ;    וְעֶבֶד אֱוִיל, לַחֲכַם-לֵב.
29.english: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind; and the foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.

30.hebrew: פְּרִי-צַדִּיק, עֵץ חַיִּים;    וְלֹקֵחַ נְפָשׁוֹת חָכָם.
30.english: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that is wise winneth souls.

31.hebrew: הֵן צַדִּיק, בָּאָרֶץ יְשֻׁלָּם;    אַף, כִּי-רָשָׁע וְחוֹטֵא.
31.english: Behold, the righteous shall be requited in the earth; how much more the wicked and the sinner!

1.hebrew: אֹהֵב מוּסָר, אֹהֵב דָּעַת;    וְשׂוֹנֵא תוֹכַחַת בָּעַר.
1.english: Whoso loveth knowledge loveth correction; but he that is brutish hateth reproof.

2.hebrew: טוֹב--יָפִיק רָצוֹן, מֵיְהוָה;    וְאִישׁ מְזִמּוֹת יַרְשִׁיעַ.
2.english: A good man shall obtain favour of the LORD; but a man of wicked devices will He condemn.

3.hebrew: לֹא-יִכּוֹן אָדָם בְּרֶשַׁע;    וְשֹׁרֶשׁ צַדִּיקִים, בַּל-יִמּוֹט.
3.english: A man shall not be established by wickedness; but the root of the righteous shall never be moved.

4.hebrew: אֵשֶׁת-חַיִל, עֲטֶרֶת בַּעְלָהּ;    וּכְרָקָב בְּעַצְמוֹתָיו מְבִישָׁה.
4.english: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband; but she that doeth shamefully is as rottenness in his bones.

5.hebrew: מַחְשְׁבוֹת צַדִּיקִים מִשְׁפָּט;    תַּחְבֻּלוֹת רְשָׁעִים מִרְמָה.
5.english: The thoughts of the righteous are right; but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.

6.hebrew: דִּבְרֵי רְשָׁעִים אֱרָב-דָּם;    וּפִי יְשָׁרִים, יַצִּילֵם.
6.english: The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood; but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.

7.hebrew: הָפוֹךְ רְשָׁעִים וְאֵינָם;    וּבֵית צַדִּיקִים יַעֲמֹד.
7.english: The wicked are overthrown, and are not; but the house of the righteous shall stand.

8.hebrew: לְפִי-שִׂכְלוֹ, יְהֻלַּל-אִישׁ;    וְנַעֲוֵה-לֵב, יִהְיֶה לָבוּז.
8.english: A man shall be commended according to his intelligence; but he that is of a distorted understanding shall be despised.

9.hebrew: טוֹב נִקְלֶה, וְעֶבֶד לוֹ--    מִמִּתְכַּבֵּד, וַחֲסַר-לָחֶם.
9.english: Better is he that is lightly esteemed, and hath a servant, than he that playeth the man of rank, and lacketh bread.

10.hebrew: יוֹדֵעַ צַדִּיק, נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֶמְתּוֹ;    וְרַחֲמֵי רְשָׁעִים, אַכְזָרִי.
10.english: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast; but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

11.hebrew: עֹבֵד אַדְמָתוֹ, יִשְׂבַּע-לָחֶם;    וּמְרַדֵּף רֵיקִים חֲסַר-לֵב.
11.english: He that tilleth his ground shall have plenty of bread; but he that followeth after vain things is void of understanding.

12.hebrew: חָמַד רָשָׁע, מְצוֹד רָעִים;    וְשֹׁרֶשׁ צַדִּיקִים יִתֵּן.
12.english: The wicked desireth the prey of evil men; but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.

13.hebrew: בְּפֶשַׁע שְׂפָתַיִם, מוֹקֵשׁ רָע;    וַיֵּצֵא מִצָּרָה צַדִּיק.
13.english: In the transgression of the lips is a snare to the evil man; but the righteous cometh out of trouble.

14.hebrew: מִפְּרִי פִי-אִישׁ, יִשְׂבַּע-טוֹב;    וּגְמוּל יְדֵי-אָדָם, ישוב (יָשִׁיב) לוֹ.
14.english: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth, and the doings of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.

15.hebrew: דֶּרֶךְ אֱוִיל, יָשָׁר בְּעֵינָיו;    וְשֹׁמֵעַ לְעֵצָה חָכָם.
15.english: The way of a fool is straight in his own eyes; but he that is wise hearkeneth unto counsel.

16.hebrew: אֱוִיל--בַּיּוֹם, יִוָּדַע כַּעְסוֹ;    וְכֹסֶה קָלוֹן עָרוּם.
16.english: A fool's vexation is presently known; but a prudent man concealeth shame.

17.hebrew: יָפִיחַ אֱמוּנָה, יַגִּיד צֶדֶק;    וְעֵד שְׁקָרִים מִרְמָה.
17.english: He that breatheth forth truth uttereth righteousness; but a false witness deceit.

18.hebrew: יֵשׁ בּוֹטֶה, כְּמַדְקְרוֹת חָרֶב;    וּלְשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים מַרְפֵּא.
18.english: There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword; but the tongue of the wise is health.

19.hebrew: שְׂפַת-אֱמֶת, תִּכּוֹן לָעַד;    וְעַד-אַרְגִּיעָה, לְשׁוֹן שָׁקֶר.
19.english: The lip of truth shall be established for ever; but a lying tongue is but for a moment.

20.hebrew: מִרְמָה, בְּלֶב-חֹרְשֵׁי רָע;    וּלְיֹעֲצֵי שָׁלוֹם שִׂמְחָה.
20.english: Deceit is in the heart of them that devise evil; but to the counsellors of peace is joy.

21.hebrew: לֹא-יְאֻנֶּה לַצַּדִּיק כָּל-אָוֶן;    וּרְשָׁעִים, מָלְאוּ רָע.
21.english: There shall no mischief befall the righteous; but the wicked are filled with evil.

22.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה, שִׂפְתֵי-שָׁקֶר;    וְעֹשֵׂי אֱמוּנָה רְצוֹנוֹ.
22.english: Lying lips are an abomination to the LORD; but they that deal truly are His delight.

23.hebrew: אָדָם עָרוּם, כֹּסֶה דָּעַת;    וְלֵב כְּסִילִים, יִקְרָא אִוֶּלֶת.
23.english: A prudent man concealeth knowledge; but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.

24.hebrew: יַד-חָרוּצִים תִּמְשׁוֹל;    וּרְמִיָּה, תִּהְיֶה לָמַס.
24.english: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule; but the slothful shall be under tribute.

25.hebrew: דְּאָגָה בְלֶב-אִישׁ יַשְׁחֶנָּה;    וְדָבָר טוֹב יְשַׂמְּחֶנָּה.
25.english: Care in the heart of a man boweth it down; but a good word maketh it glad.

26.hebrew: יָתֵר מֵרֵעֵהוּ צַדִּיק;    וְדֶרֶךְ רְשָׁעִים תַּתְעֵם.
26.english: The righteous is guided by his friend; but the way of the wicked leadeth them astray.

27.hebrew: לֹא-יַחֲרֹךְ רְמִיָּה צֵידוֹ;    וְהוֹן-אָדָם יָקָר חָרוּץ.
27.english: The slothful man shall not hunt his prey; but the precious substance of men is to be diligent.

28.hebrew: בְּאֹרַח-צְדָקָה חַיִּים;    וְדֶרֶךְ נְתִיבָה אַל-מָוֶת.
28.english: In the way of righteousness is life, and in the pathway thereof there is no death.

1.hebrew: בֵּן חָכָם, מוּסַר אָב;    וְלֵץ, לֹא-שָׁמַע גְּעָרָה.
1.english: A wise son is instructed of his father; but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

2.hebrew: מִפְּרִי פִי-אִישׁ, יֹאכַל טוֹב;    וְנֶפֶשׁ בֹּגְדִים חָמָס.
2.english: A man shall eat good from the fruit of his mouth; but the desire of the faithless is violence.

3.hebrew: נֹצֵר פִּיו, שֹׁמֵר נַפְשׁוֹ;    פֹּשֵׂק שְׂפָתָיו, מְחִתָּה-לוֹ.
3.english: He that guardeth his mouth keepeth his life; but for him that openeth wide his lips there shall be ruin.

4.hebrew: מִתְאַוָּה וָאַיִן, נַפְשׁוֹ עָצֵל;    וְנֶפֶשׁ חָרֻצִים תְּדֻשָּׁן.
4.english: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing; but the soul of the diligent shall be abundantly gratified.

5.hebrew: דְּבַר-שֶׁקֶר, יִשְׂנָא צַדִּיק;    וְרָשָׁע, יַבְאִישׁ וְיַחְפִּיר.
5.english: A righteous man hateth lying; but a wicked man behaveth vilely and shamefully.

6.hebrew: צְדָקָה, תִּצֹּר תָּם-דָּרֶךְ;    וְרִשְׁעָה, תְּסַלֵּף חַטָּאת.
6.english: Righteousness guardeth him that is upright in the way; but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

7.hebrew: יֵשׁ מִתְעַשֵּׁר, וְאֵין כֹּל;    מִתְרוֹשֵׁשׁ, וְהוֹן רָב.
7.english: There is that pretendeth himself rich, yet hath nothing; there is that pretendeth himself poor, yet hath great wealth.

8.hebrew: כֹּפֶר נֶפֶשׁ-אִישׁ עָשְׁרוֹ;    וְרָשׁ, לֹא-שָׁמַע גְּעָרָה.
8.english: The ransom of a man's life are his riches; but the poor heareth no threatening.

9.hebrew: אוֹר-צַדִּיקִים יִשְׂמָח;    וְנֵר רְשָׁעִים יִדְעָךְ.
9.english: The light of the righteous rejoiceth; but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

10.hebrew: רַק-בְּזָדוֹן, יִתֵּן מַצָּה;    וְאֶת-נוֹעָצִים חָכְמָה.
10.english: By pride cometh only contention; but with the well-advised is wisdom.

11.hebrew: הוֹן, מֵהֶבֶל יִמְעָט;    וְקֹבֵץ עַל-יָד יַרְבֶּה.
11.english: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished; but he that gathereth little by little shall increase.

12.hebrew: תּוֹחֶלֶת מְמֻשָּׁכָה, מַחֲלָה-לֵב;    וְעֵץ חַיִּים, תַּאֲוָה בָאָה.
12.english: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick; but desire fulfilled is a tree of life.

13.hebrew: בָּז לְדָבָר, יֵחָבֶל לוֹ;    וִירֵא מִצְוָה, הוּא יְשֻׁלָּם.
13.english: Whoso despiseth the word shall suffer thereby; but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

14.hebrew: תּוֹרַת חָכָם, מְקוֹר חַיִּים--    לָסוּר, מִמֹּקְשֵׁי מָוֶת.
14.english: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

15.hebrew: שֵׂכֶל-טוֹב, יִתֶּן-חֵן;    וְדֶרֶךְ בֹּגְדִים אֵיתָן.
15.english: Good understanding giveth grace; but the way of the faithless is harsh.

16.hebrew: כָּל-עָרוּם, יַעֲשֶׂה בְדָעַת;    וּכְסִיל, יִפְרֹשׂ אִוֶּלֶת.
16.english: Every prudent man dealeth with forethought; but a fool unfoldeth folly.

17.hebrew: מַלְאָךְ רָשָׁע, יִפֹּל בְּרָע;    וְצִיר אֱמוּנִים מַרְפֵּא.
17.english: A wicked messenger falleth into evil; but a faithful ambassador is health.

18.hebrew: רֵישׁ וְקָלוֹן, פּוֹרֵעַ מוּסָר;    וְשֹׁמֵר תּוֹכַחַת יְכֻבָּד.
18.english: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction; but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

19.hebrew: תַּאֲוָה נִהְיָה, תֶּעֱרַב לְנָפֶשׁ;    וְתוֹעֲבַת כְּסִילִים, סוּר מֵרָע.
19.english: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul; and it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.

20.hebrew: הלוך (הוֹלֵךְ) אֶת-חֲכָמִים וחכם (יֶחְכָּם);    וְרֹעֶה כְסִילִים יֵרוֹעַ.
20.english: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise; but the companion of fools shall smart for it.

21.hebrew: חַטָּאִים, תְּרַדֵּף רָעָה;    וְאֶת-צַדִּיקִים, יְשַׁלֶּם-טוֹב.
21.english: Evil pursueth sinners; but to the righteous good shall be repaid.

22.hebrew: טוֹב--יַנְחִיל בְּנֵי-בָנִים;    וְצָפוּן לַצַּדִּיק, חֵיל חוֹטֵא.
22.english: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children's children; and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the righteous.

23.hebrew: רָב-אֹכֶל, נִיר רָאשִׁים;    וְיֵשׁ נִסְפֶּה, בְּלֹא מִשְׁפָּט.
23.english: Much food is in the tillage of the poor; but there is that is swept away by want of righteousness.

24.hebrew: חוֹשֵׂךְ שִׁבְטוֹ, שׂוֹנֵא בְנוֹ;    וְאֹהֲבוֹ, שִׁחֲרוֹ מוּסָר.
24.english: He that spareth his rod hateth his son; but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

25.hebrew: צַדִּיק--אֹכֵל, לְשֹׂבַע נַפְשׁוֹ;    וּבֶטֶן רְשָׁעִים תֶּחְסָר.
25.english: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his desire; but the belly of the wicked shall want.

1.hebrew: חַכְמוֹת נָשִׁים, בָּנְתָה בֵיתָהּ;    וְאִוֶּלֶת, בְּיָדֶיהָ תֶהֶרְסֶנּוּ.
1.english: Every wise woman buildeth her house; but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

2.hebrew: הוֹלֵךְ בְּיָשְׁרוֹ, יְרֵא יְהוָה;    וּנְלוֹז דְּרָכָיו בּוֹזֵהוּ.
2.english: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD; but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth Him.

3.hebrew: בְּפִי-אֱוִיל, חֹטֶר גַּאֲוָה;    וְשִׂפְתֵי חֲכָמִים, תִּשְׁמוּרֵם.
3.english: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride; but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

4.hebrew: בְּאֵין אֲלָפִים, אֵבוּס בָּר;    וְרָב-תְּבוּאוֹת, בְּכֹחַ שׁוֹר.
4.english: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean; but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

5.hebrew: עֵד אֱמוּנִים, לֹא יְכַזֵּב;    וְיָפִיחַ כְּזָבִים, עֵד שָׁקֶר.
5.english: A faithful witness will not lie; but a false witness breatheth forth lies.

6.hebrew: בִּקֶּשׁ-לֵץ חָכְמָה וָאָיִן;    וְדַעַת לְנָבוֹן נָקָל.
6.english: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not; but knowledge is easy unto him that hath discernment.

7.hebrew: לֵךְ מִנֶּגֶד, לְאִישׁ כְּסִיל;    וּבַל-יָדַעְתָּ, שִׂפְתֵי-דָעַת.
7.english: Go from the presence of a foolish man, for thou wilt not perceive the lips of knowledge.

8.hebrew: חָכְמַת עָרוּם, הָבִין דַּרְכּוֹ;    וְאִוֶּלֶת כְּסִילִים מִרְמָה.
8.english: The wisdom of the prudent is to look well to his way; but the folly of fools is deceit.

9.hebrew: אֱוִלִים, יָלִיץ אָשָׁם;    וּבֵין יְשָׁרִים רָצוֹן.
9.english: Amends pleadeth for fools; but among the upright there is good will.

10.hebrew: לֵב--יוֹדֵעַ, מָרַּת נַפְשׁוֹ;    וּבְשִׂמְחָתוֹ, לֹא-יִתְעָרַב זָר.
10.english: The heart knoweth its own bitterness; and with its joy no stranger can intermeddle.

11.hebrew: בֵּית רְשָׁעִים, יִשָּׁמֵד;    וְאֹהֶל יְשָׁרִים יַפְרִיחַ.
11.english: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown; but the tent of the upright shall flourish.

12.hebrew: יֵשׁ דֶּרֶךְ יָשָׁר, לִפְנֵי-אִישׁ;    וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ, דַּרְכֵי-מָוֶת.
12.english: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

13.hebrew: גַּם-בִּשְׂחֹק יִכְאַב-לֵב;    וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ שִׂמְחָה תוּגָה.
13.english: Even in laughter the heart acheth; and the end of mirth is heaviness.

14.hebrew: מִדְּרָכָיו יִשְׂבַּע, סוּג לֵב;    וּמֵעָלָיו, אִישׁ טוֹב.
14.english: The dissembler in heart shall have his fill from his own ways; and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

15.hebrew: פֶּתִי, יַאֲמִין לְכָל-דָּבָר;    וְעָרוּם, יָבִין לַאֲשֻׁרוֹ.
15.english: The thoughtless believeth every word; but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

16.hebrew: חָכָם יָרֵא, וְסָר מֵרָע;    וּכְסִיל, מִתְעַבֵּר וּבוֹטֵחַ.
16.english: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil; but the fool behaveth overbearingly, and is confident.

17.hebrew: קְצַר-אַפַּיִם, יַעֲשֶׂה אִוֶּלֶת;    וְאִישׁ מְזִמּוֹת, יִשָּׂנֵא.
17.english: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly; and a man of wicked devices is hated.

18.hebrew: נָחֲלוּ פְתָאיִם אִוֶּלֶת;    וַעֲרוּמִים, יַכְתִּרוּ דָעַת.
18.english: The thoughtless come into possession of folly; but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

19.hebrew: שַׁחוּ רָעִים, לִפְנֵי טוֹבִים;    וּרְשָׁעִים, עַל-שַׁעֲרֵי צַדִּיק.
19.english: The evil bow before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

20.hebrew: גַּם-לְרֵעֵהוּ, יִשָּׂנֵא רָשׁ;    וְאֹהֲבֵי עָשִׁיר רַבִּים.
20.english: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour; but the rich hath many friends.

21.hebrew: בָּז-לְרֵעֵהוּ חוֹטֵא;    וּמְחוֹנֵן עניים (עֲנָוִים) אַשְׁרָיו.
21.english: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth; but he that is gracious unto the humble, happy is he.

22.hebrew: הֲלוֹא-יִתְעוּ, חֹרְשֵׁי רָע;    וְחֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת, חֹרְשֵׁי טוֹב.
22.english: Shall they not go astray that devise evil? But mercy and truth shall be for them that devise good.

23.hebrew: בְּכָל-עֶצֶב, יִהְיֶה מוֹתָר;    וּדְבַר-שְׂפָתַיִם, אַךְ-לְמַחְסוֹר.
23.english: In all labour there is profit; but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

24.hebrew: עֲטֶרֶת חֲכָמִים עָשְׁרָם;    אִוֶּלֶת כְּסִילִים אִוֶּלֶת.
24.english: The crown of the wise is their riches; but the folly of fools remaineth folly.

25.hebrew: מַצִּיל נְפָשׁוֹת, עֵד אֱמֶת;    וְיָפִחַ כְּזָבִים מִרְמָה.
25.english: A true witness delivereth souls; but he that breatheth forth lies is all deceit.

26.hebrew: בְּיִרְאַת יְהוָה, מִבְטַח-עֹז;    וּלְבָנָיו, יִהְיֶה מַחְסֶה.
26.english: In the fear of the LORD a man hath strong confidence; and his children shall have a place of refuge.

27.hebrew: יִרְאַת יְהוָה, מְקוֹר חַיִּים--    לָסוּר, מִמֹּקְשֵׁי מָוֶת.
27.english: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

28.hebrew: בְּרָב-עָם הַדְרַת-מֶלֶךְ;    וּבְאֶפֶס לְאֹם, מְחִתַּת רָזוֹן.
28.english: In the multitude of people is the king's glory; but in the want of people is the ruin of the prince.

29.hebrew: אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם, רַב-תְּבוּנָה;    וּקְצַר-רוּחַ, מֵרִים אִוֶּלֶת.
29.english: He that is slow to anger is of great understanding; but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

30.hebrew: חַיֵּי בְשָׂרִים, לֵב מַרְפֵּא;    וּרְקַב עֲצָמוֹת קִנְאָה.
30.english: A tranquil heart is the life of the flesh; but envy is the rottenness of the bones.

31.hebrew: עֹשֵׁק דָּל, חֵרֵף עֹשֵׂהוּ;    וּמְכַבְּדוֹ, חֹנֵן אֶבְיוֹן.
31.english: He that oppresseth the poor blasphemeth his Maker; but he that is gracious unto the needy honoureth Him.

32.hebrew: בְּרָעָתוֹ, יִדָּחֶה רָשָׁע;    וְחֹסֶה בְמוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק.
32.english: The wicked is thrust down in his misfortune; but the righteous, even when he is brought to death, hath hope.

33.hebrew: בְּלֵב נָבוֹן, תָּנוּחַ חָכְמָה;    וּבְקֶרֶב כְּסִילִים, תִּוָּדֵעַ.
33.english: In the heart of him that hath discernment wisdom resteth; but in the inward part of fools it maketh itself known.

34.english: Righteousness exalteth a nation; but sin is a reproach to any people.

35.hebrew: רְצוֹן-מֶלֶךְ, לְעֶבֶד מַשְׂכִּיל;    וְעֶבְרָתוֹ, תִּהְיֶה מֵבִישׁ.
35.english: The king's favour is toward a servant that dealeth wisely; but his wrath striketh him that dealeth shamefully.

1.hebrew: מַעֲנֶה-רַּךְ, יָשִׁיב חֵמָה;    וּדְבַר-עֶצֶב, יַעֲלֶה-אָף.
1.english: A soft answer turneth away wrath; but a grievous word stirreth up anger.

2.hebrew: לְשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים, תֵּיטִיב דָּעַת;    וּפִי כְסִילִים, יַבִּיעַ אִוֶּלֶת.
2.english: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright; but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.

3.hebrew: בְּכָל-מָקוֹם, עֵינֵי יְהוָה;    צֹפוֹת, רָעִים וְטוֹבִים.
3.english: The eyes of the LORD are in every place, keeping watch upon the evil and the good.

4.hebrew: מַרְפֵּא לָשׁוֹן, עֵץ חַיִּים;    וְסֶלֶף בָּהּ, שֶׁבֶר בְּרוּחַ.
4.english: A soothing tongue is a tree of life; but perverseness therein is a wound to the spirit.

5.hebrew: אֱוִיל--יִנְאַץ, מוּסַר אָבִיו;    וְשֹׁמֵר תּוֹכַחַת יַעְרִים.
5.english: A fool despiseth his father's correction; but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.

6.hebrew: בֵּית צַדִּיק, חֹסֶן רָב;    וּבִתְבוּאַת רָשָׁע נֶעְכָּרֶת.
6.english: In the house of the righteous is much treasure; but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.

7.hebrew: שִׂפְתֵי חֲכָמִים, יְזָרוּ דָעַת;    וְלֵב כְּסִילִים לֹא-כֵן.
7.english: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge; but the heart of the foolish is not stedfast.

8.hebrew: זֶבַח רְשָׁעִים, תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה;    וּתְפִלַּת יְשָׁרִים רְצוֹנוֹ.
8.english: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD; but the prayer of the upright is His delight.

9.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה, דֶּרֶךְ רָשָׁע;    וּמְרַדֵּף צְדָקָה יֶאֱהָב.
9.english: The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD; but He loveth him that followeth after righteousness.

10.hebrew: מוּסָר רָע, לְעֹזֵב אֹרַח;    שׂוֹנֵא תוֹכַחַת יָמוּת.
10.english: There is grievous correction for him that forsaketh the way; and he that hateth reproof shall die.

11.hebrew: שְׁאוֹל וַאֲבַדּוֹן, נֶגֶד יְהוָה;    אַף, כִּי-לִבּוֹת בְּנֵי-אָדָם.
11.english: The nether-world and Destruction are before the LORD; how much more then the hearts of the children of men!

12.hebrew: לֹא יֶאֱהַב-לֵץ, הוֹכֵחַ לוֹ;    אֶל-חֲכָמִים, לֹא יֵלֵךְ.
12.english: A scorner loveth not to be reproved; he will not go unto the wise.

13.hebrew: לֵב שָׂמֵחַ, יֵיטִב פָּנִים;    וּבְעַצְּבַת-לֵב, רוּחַ נְכֵאָה.
13.english: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance; but by sorrow of heart the spirit is broken.

14.hebrew: לֵב נָבוֹן, יְבַקֶּשׁ-דָּעַת;    ופני (וּפִי) כְסִילִים, יִרְעֶה אִוֶּלֶת.
14.english: The heart of him that hath discernment seeketh knowledge; but the mouth of fools feedeth on folly.

15.hebrew: כָּל-יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים;    וְטוֹב-לֵב, מִשְׁתֶּה תָמִיד.
15.english: All the days of the poor are evil; but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.

16.hebrew: טוֹב-מְעַט, בְּיִרְאַת יְהוָה--    מֵאוֹצָר רָב, וּמְהוּמָה בוֹ.
16.english: Better is little with the fear of the LORD, than great treasure and turmoil therewith.

17.hebrew: טוֹב אֲרֻחַת יָרָק, וְאַהֲבָה-שָׁם--    מִשּׁוֹר אָבוּס, וְשִׂנְאָה-בוֹ.
17.english: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

18.hebrew: אִישׁ חֵמָה, יְגָרֶה מָדוֹן;    וְאֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם, יַשְׁקִיט רִיב.
18.english: A wrathful man stirreth up discord; but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.

19.hebrew: דֶּרֶךְ עָצֵל, כִּמְשֻׂכַת חָדֶק;    וְאֹרַח יְשָׁרִים סְלֻלָה.
19.english: The way of the sluggard is as though hedged by thorns; but the path of the upright is even.

20.hebrew: בֵּן חָכָם, יְשַׂמַּח-אָב;    וּכְסִיל אָדָם, בּוֹזֶה אִמּוֹ.
20.english: A wise son maketh a glad father; but a foolish man despiseth his mother.

21.hebrew: אִוֶּלֶת, שִׂמְחָה לַחֲסַר-לֵב;    וְאִישׁ תְּבוּנָה, יְיַשֶּׁר-לָכֶת.
21.english: Folly is joy to him that lacketh understanding; but a man of discernment walketh straightforwards.

22.hebrew: הָפֵר מַחֲשָׁבוֹת, בְּאֵין סוֹד;    וּבְרֹב יוֹעֲצִים תָּקוּם.
22.english: For want of counsel purposes are frustrated; but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

23.hebrew: שִׂמְחָה לָאִישׁ, בְּמַעֲנֵה-פִיו;    וְדָבָר בְּעִתּוֹ מַה-טּוֹב.
23.english: A man hath joy in the answer of his mouth; and a word in due season, how good is it!

24.hebrew: אֹרַח חַיִּים, לְמַעְלָה לְמַשְׂכִּיל--    לְמַעַן סוּר, מִשְּׁאוֹל מָטָּה.
24.english: The path of life goeth upward for the wise, that he may depart from the nether-world beneath.

25.hebrew: בֵּית גֵּאִים, יִסַּח יְהוָה;    וְיַצֵּב, גְּבוּל אַלְמָנָה.
25.english: The LORD will pluck up the house of the proud; but He will establish the border of the widow.

26.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה, מַחְשְׁבוֹת רָע;    וּטְהֹרִים, אִמְרֵי-נֹעַם.
26.english: The thoughts of wickedness are an abomination to the LORD; but words of pleasantness are pure.

27.hebrew: עֹכֵר בֵּיתוֹ, בּוֹצֵעַ בָּצַע;    וְשׂוֹנֵא מַתָּנֹת יִחְיֶה.
27.english: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.

28.hebrew: לֵב צַדִּיק, יֶהְגֶּה לַעֲנוֹת;    וּפִי רְשָׁעִים, יַבִּיעַ רָעוֹת.
28.english: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer; but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.

29.hebrew: רָחוֹק יְהוָה, מֵרְשָׁעִים;    וּתְפִלַּת צַדִּיקִים יִשְׁמָע.
29.english: The LORD is far from the wicked; but He heareth the prayer of the righteous.

30.english: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart; and a good report maketh the bones fat.

31.hebrew: אֹזֶן--שֹׁמַעַת, תּוֹכַחַת חַיִּים:    בְּקֶרֶב חֲכָמִים תָּלִין.
31.english: The ear that hearkeneth to the reproof of life abideth among the wise.

32.hebrew: פּוֹרֵעַ מוּסָר, מוֹאֵס נַפְשׁוֹ;    וְשׁוֹמֵעַ תּוֹכַחַת, קוֹנֶה לֵּב.
32.english: He that refuseth correction despiseth his own soul; but he that hearkeneth to reproof getteth understanding.

33.hebrew: יִרְאַת יְהוָה, מוּסַר חָכְמָה;    וְלִפְנֵי כָבוֹד עֲנָוָה.
33.english: The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour goeth humility.

20.english: He that giveth heed unto the word shall find good; and whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.

21.english: The wise in heart is called a man of discernment; and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.

22.english: Understanding is a fountain of life unto him that hath it; but folly is the chastisement of fools.

23.english: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.

27.english: An ungodly man diggeth up evil, and in his lips there is as a burning fire.

28.english: A froward man soweth strife; and a whisperer separateth familiar friends.

29.hebrew: ††аƒйщ— з»о»с, йјф«ъћ∆д ш≈т≈дећ; †† ејде…мƒйле…, бћјг∆ш∆кј м…а-ие…б.
29.english: A man of violence enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into a way that is not good.

30.hebrew: ††т…ц∆д т≈йр»йе, м«зјщ—…б ъћ«дјфћЋле…ъ; †† ч…ш≈х щ“јф»ъ»йе, лћƒмћ»д ш»т»д.
30.english: He that shutteth his eyes, it is to devise froward things; he that biteth his lips bringeth evil to pass.

31.english: The hoary head is a crown of glory, it is found in the way of righteousness.

32.hebrew: ††ие…б а∆ш∆кј а«фћ«йƒн, оƒвћƒбће…ш; †† ећо…щ—≈м бћјшећзе…, оƒмћ…л≈г тƒйш.
32.english: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

33.english: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.

1.hebrew: èåÉá ôÌÇú çÂøÅáÈä, åÀùÑÇìÀåÈä-áÈäÌ--    îÄáÌÇéÄú, îÈìÅà æÄáÀçÅé-øÄéá.

8.english: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it; whithersoever he turneth, he prospereth.

10.english: A rebuke entereth deeper into a man of understanding than a hundred stripes into a fool.

11.english: A rebellious man seeketh only evil; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

12.english: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

13.hebrew: îÅùÑÄéá øÈòÈä, úÌÇçÇú èåÉáÈä--    ìÉà-úîéù (úÈîåÌùÑ) øÈòÈä, îÄáÌÅéúåÉ.
13.english: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

14.english: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water; therefore leave off contention, before the quarrel break out.

15.english: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, even they both are an abomination to the LORD.

16.english: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, seeing he hath no understanding?

17.english: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

18.english: A man void of understanding is he that striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his neighbour.

19.english: He loveth transgression that loveth strife; he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.

20.hebrew: òÄ÷ÌÆùÑ-ìÅá, ìÉà éÄîÀöÈà-èåÉá;    åÀğÆäÀôÌÈêÀ áÌÄìÀùÑåÉğåÉ, éÄôÌåÉì áÌÀøÈòÈä.
20.english: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good; and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into evil.

21.english: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow; and the father of a churl hath no joy.

22.english: A merry heart is a good medicine; but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

23.english: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom, to pervert the ways of justice.

24.english: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

25.english: A foolish son is vexation to his father, and bitterness to her that bore him.

26.hebrew: âÌÇí òÂğåÉùÑ ìÇöÌÇãÌÄé÷ ìÉà-èåÉá--    ìÀäÇëÌåÉú ğÀãÄéáÄéí òÇì-éÉùÑÆø.
26.english: To punish also the righteous is not good, nor to strike the noble for their uprightness.

27.hebrew: çåÉùÒÅêÀ àÂîÈøÈéå, éåÉãÅòÇ ãÌÈòÇú;    å÷ø- (éÀ÷Çø-) øåÌçÇ, àÄéùÑ úÌÀáåÌğÈä.
27.english: He that spareth his words hath knowledge; and he that husbandeth his spirit is a man of discernment.

28.hebrew: âÌÇí àÁåÄéì îÇçÂøÄéùÑ, çÈëÈí éÅçÈùÑÅá;    àÉèÅí ùÒÀôÈúÈéå ğÈáåÉï.
28.english: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise; and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed as a man of understanding.

1.hebrew: לְתַאֲוָה, יְבַקֵּשׁ נִפְרָד;    בְּכָל-תּוּשִׁיָּה, יִתְגַּלָּע.
1.english: He that separateth himself seeketh his own desire, and snarlest against all sound wisdom.

2.hebrew: לֹא-יַחְפֹּץ כְּסִיל, בִּתְבוּנָה:    כִּי, אִם-בְּהִתְגַּלּוֹת לִבּוֹ.
2.english: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but only that his heart may lay itself bare.

3.hebrew: בְּבוֹא-רָשָׁע, בָּא גַם-בּוּז;    וְעִם-קָלוֹן חֶרְפָּה.
3.english: When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

4.hebrew: מַיִם עֲמֻקִּים, דִּבְרֵי פִי-אִישׁ;    נַחַל נֹבֵעַ, מְקוֹר חָכְמָה.
4.english: The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters; a flowing brook, a fountain of wisdom.

5.hebrew: שְׂאֵת פְּנֵי-רָשָׁע לֹא-טוֹב--    לְהַטּוֹת צַדִּיק, בַּמִּשְׁפָּט.
5.english: It is not good to respect the person of the wicked, so as to turn aside the righteous in judgment.

6.hebrew: שִׂפְתֵי כְסִיל, יָבֹאוּ בְרִיב;    וּפִיו, לְמַהֲלֻמוֹת יִקְרָא.
6.english: A fool's lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.

7.hebrew: פִּי-כְסִיל, מְחִתָּה-לוֹ;    וּשְׂפָתָיו, מוֹקֵשׁ נַפְשׁוֹ.
7.english: A fool's mouth is his ruin, and his lips are the snare of his soul.

8.hebrew: דִּבְרֵי נִרְגָּן, כְּמִתְלַהֲמִים;    וְהֵם, יָרְדוּ חַדְרֵי-בָטֶן.
8.english: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

9.hebrew: גַּם, מִתְרַפֶּה בִמְלַאכְתּוֹ--    אָח הוּא, לְבַעַל מַשְׁחִית.
9.english: Even one that is slack in his work is brother to him that is a destroyer.

10.hebrew: מִגְדַּל-עֹז, שֵׁם יְהוָה;    בּוֹ-יָרוּץ צַדִּיק וְנִשְׂגָּב.
10.english: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is set up on high.

11.hebrew: הוֹן עָשִׁיר, קִרְיַת עֻזּוֹ;    וּכְחוֹמָה נִשְׂגָּבָה, בְּמַשְׂכִּתוֹ.
11.english: The rich man's wealth is his strong city, and as a high wall in his own conceit.

12.hebrew: לִפְנֵי-שֶׁבֶר, יִגְבַּהּ לֶב-אִישׁ;    וְלִפְנֵי כָבוֹד עֲנָוָה.
12.english: Before destruction the heart of a man is haughty, and before honour goeth humility.

13.hebrew: מֵשִׁיב דָּבָר, בְּטֶרֶם יִשְׁמָע--    אִוֶּלֶת הִיא-לוֹ, וּכְלִמָּה.
13.english: He that giveth answer before he heareth, it is folly and confusion unto him.

14.hebrew: רוּחַ-אִישׁ, יְכַלְכֵּל מַחֲלֵהוּ;    וְרוּחַ נְכֵאָה, מִי יִשָּׂאֶנָּה.
14.english: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a broken spirit who can bear?

15.hebrew: לֵב נָבוֹן, יִקְנֶה-דָּעַת;    וְאֹזֶן חֲכָמִים, תְּבַקֶּשׁ-דָּעַת.
15.english: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

16.hebrew: מַתָּן אָדָם, יַרְחִיב לוֹ;    וְלִפְנֵי גְדֹלִים יַנְחֶנּוּ.
16.english: A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

17.hebrew: צַדִּיק הָרִאשׁוֹן בְּרִיבוֹ;    יבא- (וּבָא-) רֵעֵהוּ, וַחֲקָרוֹ.
17.english: He that pleadeth his cause first seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him out.

18.hebrew: מִדְיָנִים, יַשְׁבִּית הַגּוֹרָל;    וּבֵין עֲצוּמִים יַפְרִיד.
18.english: The lot causeth strife to cease, and parteth asunder the contentious.

19.hebrew: אָח--נִפְשָׁע מִקִּרְיַת-עֹז;    ומדונים (וּמִדְיָנִים), כִּבְרִיחַ אַרְמוֹן.
19.english: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city; and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.

20.hebrew: מִפְּרִי פִי-אִישׁ, תִּשְׂבַּע בִּטְנוֹ;    תְּבוּאַת שְׂפָתָיו יִשְׂבָּע.
20.english: A man's belly shall be filled with the fruit of his mouth; with the increase of his lips shall he be satisfied.

21.hebrew: מָוֶת וְחַיִּים, בְּיַד-לָשׁוֹן;    וְאֹהֲבֶיהָ, יֹאכַל פִּרְיָהּ.
21.english: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; and they that indulge it shall eat the fruit thereof.

22.hebrew: מָצָא אִשָּׁה, מָצָא טוֹב;    וַיָּפֶק רָצוֹן, מֵיְהוָה.
22.english: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a great good, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.

23.hebrew: תַּחֲנוּנִים יְדַבֶּר-רָשׁ;    וְעָשִׁיר, יַעֲנֶה עַזּוֹת.
23.english: The poor useth entreaties; but the rich answereth impudently.

24.hebrew: אִישׁ רֵעִים, לְהִתְרֹעֵעַ;    וְיֵשׁ אֹהֵב, דָּבֵק מֵאָח.
24.english: There are friends that one hath to his own hurt; but there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.

10.english: Luxury is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

11.english: It is the discretion of a man to be slow to anger, and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

12.english: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.

13.english: A foolish son is the calamity of his father; and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

14.english: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers; but a prudent wife is from the LORD.

15.hebrew: ††т«цјм»д, ъћ«фћƒйм ъћ«шјгћ≈о»д; †† ејр∆ф∆щ— шјоƒйћ»д ъƒшјт»б.
15.english: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and the idle soul shall suffer hunger.

16.hebrew: ††щ—…о≈ш оƒцје»д, щ—…о≈ш р«фјщ—е…; †† бће…ж≈д гјш»л»йе йеоъ (й»оећъ).
16.english: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul; but he that despiseth His ways shall die.

17.english: He that is gracious unto the poor lendeth unto the LORD; and his good deed will He repay unto him.
