18.english: Chasten thy son, for there is hope; but set not thy heart on his destruction.

19.hebrew: ††вшм- (вћјг»м-) з≈о»д, р…щ“≈а т…р∆щ—: †† лћƒй аƒн-ъћ«цћƒйм, ејте…г ъће…сƒу.
19.english: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou interpose, thou wilt add thereto.

20.hebrew: ††щ—јо«т т≈ц»д, ејч«бћ≈м оећс»ш-- †† мјо«т«п, ъћ∆зјлћ«н бћја«з¬шƒйъ∆к».
20.english: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

21.hebrew: ††ш«бће…ъ о«з¬щ—»бе…ъ бћјм∆б-аƒйщ—; †† е«т¬ц«ъ йјде»д, дƒйа ъ»чећн.
21.english: There are many devices in a man's heart; but the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.

22.hebrew: ††ъћ«а¬е«ъ а»г»н з«сјгће…; †† ејие…б-ш»щ—, о≈аƒйщ— лћ»ж»б.
22.english: The lust of a man is his shame; and a poor man is better than a liar.

23.hebrew: ††йƒшја«ъ йјде»д мјз«йћƒйн; †† ејщ“»б≈т« й»мƒйп, бћ«м-йƒфћ»ч∆г ш»т.
23.english: The fear of the LORD tendeth to life; and he that hath it shall abide satisfied, he shall not be visited with evil.

24.hebrew: ††и»о«п т»ц≈м й»ге…, бћ«цћ«мћ»з«ъ; †† вћ«н-а∆м-фћƒйдећ, м…а йјщ—ƒйб∆рћ»д.
24.english: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, and will not so much as bring it back to his mouth.

25.hebrew: ††м≈х ъћ«лћ∆д, ећф∆ъƒй й«тјшƒн; †† ејде…лƒйз« мјр»бе…п, й»бƒйп гћ»т«ъ.
25.english: When thou smitest a scorner, the simple will become prudent; and when one that hath understanding is reproved, he will understand knowledge.

26.hebrew: ††ојщ—«гћ∆г-а»б, й«бјшƒйз« а≈н-- †† бћ≈п, о≈бƒйщ— ећо«зјфћƒйш.
26.english: A son that dealeth shamefully and reproachfully will despoil his father, and chase away his mother.

27.hebrew: ††з¬г«м-бћјрƒй, мƒщ—јо…т« оећс»ш; †† мƒщ—јве…ъ, о≈аƒојш≈й-г»т«ъ.
27.english: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.

28.hebrew: ††т≈г бћјмƒйћ«т«м, й»мƒйх оƒщ—јфћ»и; †† ећфƒй шјщ—»тƒйн, йјб«мћ«т-а»е∆п.
28.english: An ungodly witness mocketh at right; and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.

29.english: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.

1.hebrew: לֵץ הַיַּיִן, הֹמֶה שֵׁכָר;    וְכָל-שֹׁגֶה בּוֹ, לֹא יֶחְכָּם.
1.english: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is riotous; and whosoever reeleth thereby is not wise.

2.hebrew: נַהַם כַּכְּפִיר, אֵימַת מֶלֶךְ;    מִתְעַבְּרוֹ, חוֹטֵא נַפְשׁוֹ.
2.english: The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: he that provoketh him to anger forfeiteth his life.

3.hebrew: כָּבוֹד לָאִישׁ, שֶׁבֶת מֵרִיב;    וְכָל-אֱוִיל, יִתְגַּלָּע.
3.english: It is an honour for a man to keep aloof from strife; but every fool will be snarling.

4.hebrew: מֵחֹרֶף, עָצֵל לֹא-יַחֲרֹשׁ;    ישאל (וְשָׁאַל) בַּקָּצִיר וָאָיִן.
4.english: The sluggard will not plow when winter setteth in; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

5.hebrew: מַיִם עֲמֻקִּים, עֵצָה בְלֶב-אִישׁ;    וְאִישׁ תְּבוּנָה יִדְלֶנָּה.
5.english: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

6.hebrew: רָב-אָדָם--יִקְרָא, אִישׁ חַסְדּוֹ;    וְאִישׁ אֱמוּנִים, מִי יִמְצָא.
6.english: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness; but a faithful man who can find?

7.hebrew: מִתְהַלֵּךְ בְּתֻמּוֹ צַדִּיק;    אַשְׁרֵי בָנָיו אַחֲרָיו.
7.english: He that walketh in his integrity as a just man, happy are his children after him.

8.hebrew: מֶלֶךְ, יוֹשֵׁב עַל-כִּסֵּא-דִין--    מְזָרֶה בְעֵינָיו כָּל-רָע.
8.english: A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

9.hebrew: מִי-יֹאמַר, זִכִּיתִי לִבִּי;    טָהַרְתִּי, מֵחַטָּאתִי.
9.english: Who can say: 'I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin'?

10.hebrew: אֶבֶן וָאֶבֶן, אֵיפָה וְאֵיפָה--    תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה, גַּם-שְׁנֵיהֶם.
10.english: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them alike are an abomination to the LORD.

11.hebrew: גַּם בְּמַעֲלָלָיו, יִתְנַכֶּר-נָעַר--    אִם-זַךְ וְאִם-יָשָׁר פָּעֳלוֹ.
11.english: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

12.hebrew: אֹזֶן שֹׁמַעַת, וְעַיִן רֹאָה--    יְהוָה, עָשָׂה גַם-שְׁנֵיהֶם.
12.english: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.

13.hebrew: אַל-תֶּאֱהַב שֵׁנָה, פֶּן-תִּוָּרֵשׁ;    פְּקַח עֵינֶיךָ שְׂבַע-לָחֶם.
13.english: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt have bread in plenty.

14.hebrew: רַע רַע, יֹאמַר הַקּוֹנֶה;    וְאֹזֵל לוֹ, אָז יִתְהַלָּל.
14.english: 'It is bad, it is bad', saith the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

15.hebrew: יֵשׁ זָהָב, וְרָב-פְּנִינִים;    וּכְלִי יְקָר, שִׂפְתֵי-דָעַת.
15.english: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

16.hebrew: לְקַח-בִּגְדוֹ, כִּי-עָרַב זָר;    וּבְעַד נכרים (נָכְרִיָּה) חַבְלֵהוּ.
16.english: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; and hold him in pledge that is surety for an alien woman.

17.hebrew: עָרֵב לָאִישׁ, לֶחֶם שָׁקֶר;    וְאַחַר, יִמָּלֵא-פִיהוּ חָצָץ.
17.english: Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

18.hebrew: מַחֲשָׁבוֹת, בְּעֵצָה תִכּוֹן;    וּבְתַחְבֻּלוֹת, עֲשֵׂה מִלְחָמָה.
18.english: Every purpose is established by counsel; and with good advice carry on war.

19.hebrew: גּוֹלֶה-סּוֹד, הוֹלֵךְ רָכִיל;    וּלְפֹתֶה שְׂפָתָיו, לֹא תִתְעָרָב.
19.english: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; therefore meddle not with him that openeth wide his lips.

20.hebrew: מְקַלֵּל, אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ--    יִדְעַךְ נֵרוֹ, באישון (בֶּאֱשׁוּן) חֹשֶׁךְ.
20.english: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in the blackest darkness.

21.hebrew: נַחֲלָה, מבחלת (מְבֹהֶלֶת) בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה;    וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ, לֹא תְבֹרָךְ.
21.english: An estate may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

22.hebrew: אַל-תֹּאמַר אֲשַׁלְּמָה-רָע;    קַוֵּה לַיהוָה, וְיֹשַׁע לָךְ.
22.english: Say not thou: 'I will requite evil'; wait for the LORD, and He will save thee.

23.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַת יְהוָה, אֶבֶן וָאָבֶן;    וּמֹאזְנֵי מִרְמָה לֹא-טוֹב.
23.english: Divers weights are an abomination to the LORD; and a false balance is not good.

24.hebrew: מֵיְהוָה מִצְעֲדֵי-גָבֶר;    וְאָדָם, מַה-יָּבִין דַּרְכּוֹ.
24.english: A man's goings are of the LORD; how then can man look to his way?

25.hebrew: מוֹקֵשׁ אָדָם, יָלַע קֹדֶשׁ;    וְאַחַר נְדָרִים לְבַקֵּר.
25.english: It is a snare to a man rashly to say: 'Holy', and after vows to make inquiry.

26.hebrew: מְזָרֶה רְשָׁעִים, מֶלֶךְ חָכָם;    וַיָּשֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶם אוֹפָן.
26.english: A wise king sifteth the wicked, and turneth the wheel over them.

27.hebrew: נֵר יְהוָה, נִשְׁמַת אָדָם;    חֹפֵשׂ, כָּל-חַדְרֵי-בָטֶן.
27.english: The spirit of man is the lamp of the LORD, searching all the inward parts.

28.hebrew: חֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת, יִצְּרוּ-מֶלֶךְ;    וְסָעַד בַּחֶסֶד כִּסְאוֹ.
28.english: Mercy and truth preserve the king; and his throne is upheld by mercy.

29.hebrew: תִּפְאֶרֶת בַּחוּרִים כֹּחָם;    וַהֲדַר זְקֵנִים שֵׂיבָה.
29.english: The glory of young men is their strength; and the beauty of old men is the hoary head.

30.hebrew: חַבֻּרוֹת פֶּצַע, תמריק (תַּמְרוּק) בְּרָע;    וּמַכּוֹת, חַדְרֵי-בָטֶן.
30.english: Sharp wounds cleanse away evil; so do stripes that reach the inward parts.

1.hebrew: פַּלְגֵי-מַיִם לֶב-מֶלֶךְ, בְּיַד-יְהוָה;    עַל-כָּל-אֲשֶׁר יַחְפֹּץ יַטֶּנּוּ.
1.english: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD as the watercourses: He turneth it whithersoever He will.

2.hebrew: כָּל-דֶּרֶךְ-אִישׁ, יָשָׁר בְּעֵינָיו;    וְתֹכֵן לִבּוֹת יְהוָה.
2.english: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the hearts.

3.hebrew: עֲשֹׂה, צְדָקָה וּמִשְׁפָּט--    נִבְחָר לַיהוָה מִזָּבַח.
3.english: To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

4.hebrew: רוּם-עֵינַיִם, וּרְחַב-לֵב--    נִר רְשָׁעִים חַטָּאת.
4.english: A haughty look, and a proud heart--the tillage of the wicked is sin.

5.hebrew: מַחְשְׁבוֹת חָרוּץ, אַךְ-לְמוֹתָר;    וְכָל-אָץ, אַךְ-לְמַחְסוֹר.
5.english: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but every one that is hasty hasteth only to want.

6.hebrew: פֹּעַל אֹצָרוֹת, בִּלְשׁוֹן שָׁקֶר--    הֶבֶל נִדָּף, מְבַקְשֵׁי-מָוֶת.
6.english: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vapour driven to and fro; they [that seek them] seek death.

7.hebrew: שֹׁד-רְשָׁעִים יְגוֹרֵם:    כִּי מֵאֲנוּ, לַעֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט.
7.english: The violence of the wicked shall drag them away; because they refuse to do justly.

8.hebrew: הֲפַכְפַּךְ דֶּרֶךְ אִישׁ וָזָר;    וְזַךְ, יָשָׁר פָּעֳלוֹ.
8.english: The way of man is froward and strange; but as for the pure, his work is right.

9.hebrew: טוֹב, לָשֶׁבֶת עַל-פִּנַּת-גָּג--    מֵאֵשֶׁת מִדְיָנִים, וּבֵית חָבֶר.
9.english: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than in a house in common with a contentious woman.

10.hebrew: נֶפֶשׁ רָשָׁע, אִוְּתָה-רָע;    לֹא-יֻחַן בְּעֵינָיו רֵעֵהוּ.
10.english: The soul of the wicked desireth evil; his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

11.hebrew: בַּעֲנָשׁ-לֵץ, יֶחְכַּם-פֶּתִי;    וּבְהַשְׂכִּיל לְחָכָם, יִקַּח-דָּעַת.
11.english: When the scorner is punished, the thoughtless is made wise; and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

12.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּיל צַדִּיק, לְבֵית רָשָׁע;    מְסַלֵּף רְשָׁעִים לָרָע.
12.english: The Righteous One considereth the house of the wicked; overthrowing the wicked to their ruin.

13.hebrew: אֹטֵם אָזְנוֹ, מִזַּעֲקַת-דָּל--    גַּם-הוּא יִקְרָא, וְלֹא יֵעָנֶה.
13.english: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be answered.

14.hebrew: מַתָּן בַּסֵּתֶר, יִכְפֶּה-אָף;    וְשֹׁחַד בַּחֵק, חֵמָה עַזָּה.
14.english: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a present in the bosom strong wrath.

15.hebrew: שִׂמְחָה לַצַּדִּיק, עֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט;    וּמְחִתָּה, לְפֹעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
15.english: To do justly is joy to the righteous, but ruin to the workers of iniquity.

16.hebrew: אָדָם--תּוֹעֶה, מִדֶּרֶךְ הַשְׂכֵּל:    בִּקְהַל רְפָאִים יָנוּחַ.
16.english: The man that strayeth out of the way of understanding shall rest in the congregation of the shades.

17.hebrew: אִישׁ מַחְסוֹר, אֹהֵב שִׂמְחָה;    אֹהֵב יַיִן-וָשֶׁמֶן, לֹא יַעֲשִׁיר.
17.english: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man; he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

18.hebrew: כֹּפֶר לַצַּדִּיק רָשָׁע;    וְתַחַת יְשָׁרִים בּוֹגֵד.
18.english: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; and the faithless cometh in the stead of the upright.

19.hebrew: טוֹב, שֶׁבֶת בְּאֶרֶץ-מִדְבָּר--    מֵאֵשֶׁת מדונים (מִדְיָנִים) וָכָעַס.
19.english: It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful woman.

20.hebrew: אוֹצָר, נֶחְמָד וָשֶׁמֶן--בִּנְוֵה חָכָם;    וּכְסִיל אָדָם יְבַלְּעֶנּוּ.
20.english: There is desirable treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man swalloweth it up.

21.hebrew: רֹדֵף, צְדָקָה וָחָסֶד--    יִמְצָא חַיִּים, צְדָקָה וְכָבוֹד.
21.english: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, prosperity, and honour.

22.hebrew: עִיר גִּבֹּרִים, עָלָה חָכָם;    וַיֹּרֶד, עֹז מִבְטֶחָה.
22.english: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and bringeth down the stronghold wherein it trusteth.

23.hebrew: שֹׁמֵר פִּיו, וּלְשׁוֹנוֹ--    שֹׁמֵר מִצָּרוֹת נַפְשׁוֹ.
23.english: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

24.hebrew: זֵד יָהִיר, לֵץ שְׁמוֹ--    עוֹשֶׂה, בְּעֶבְרַת זָדוֹן.
24.english: A proud and haughty man, scorner is his name, even he that dealeth in overbearing pride.

25.hebrew: תַּאֲוַת עָצֵל תְּמִיתֶנּוּ:    כִּי-מֵאֲנוּ יָדָיו לַעֲשׂוֹת.
25.english: The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.

26.hebrew: כָּל-הַיּוֹם, הִתְאַוָּה תַאֲוָה;    וְצַדִּיק יִתֵּן, וְלֹא יַחְשֹׂךְ.
26.english: There is that coveteth greedily all the day long; but the righteous giveth and spareth not.

27.hebrew: זֶבַח רְשָׁעִים, תּוֹעֵבָה;    אַף, כִּי-בְזִמָּה יְבִיאֶנּוּ.
27.english: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more, when he bringeth it with the proceeds of wickedness?

28.hebrew: עֵד-כְּזָבִים יֹאבֵד;    וְאִישׁ שׁוֹמֵעַ, לָנֶצַח יְדַבֵּר.
28.english: A false witness shall perish; but the man that obeyeth shall speak unchallenged.

29.hebrew: הֵעֵז אִישׁ רָשָׁע בְּפָנָיו;    וְיָשָׁר, הוּא יכין דרכיו (יָבִין דַּרְכּוֹ).
29.english: A wicked man hardeneth his face; but as for the upright, he looketh well to his way.

30.hebrew: אֵין חָכְמָה, וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה--    וְאֵין עֵצָה, לְנֶגֶד יְהוָה.
30.english: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD. {P}

31.english: The horse is prepared against the day of battle; but victory is of the LORD.

1.hebrew: נִבְחָר שֵׁם, מֵעֹשֶׁר רָב:    מִכֶּסֶף וּמִזָּהָב, חֵן טוֹב.
1.english: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

2.hebrew: עָשִׁיר וָרָשׁ נִפְגָּשׁוּ;    עֹשֵׂה כֻלָּם יְהוָה.
2.english: The rich and the poor meet together--the LORD is the maker of them all.

3.hebrew: עָרוּם, רָאָה רָעָה ויסתר (וְנִסְתָּר);    וּפְתָיִים, עָבְרוּ וְנֶעֱנָשׁוּ.
3.english: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the thoughtless pass on, and are punished.

4.hebrew: עֵקֶב עֲנָוָה, יִרְאַת יְהוָה;    עֹשֶׁר וְכָבוֹד וְחַיִּים.
4.english: The reward of humility is the fear of the LORD, even riches, and honour, and life.

5.hebrew: צִנִּים פַּחִים, בְּדֶרֶךְ עִקֵּשׁ;    שׁוֹמֵר נַפְשׁוֹ, יִרְחַק מֵהֶם.
5.english: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward; he that keepeth his soul holdeth himself far from them.

6.hebrew: חֲנֹךְ לַנַּעַר, עַל-פִּי דַרְכּוֹ--    גַּם כִּי-יַזְקִין, לֹא-יָסוּר מִמֶּנָּה.
6.english: Train up a child in the way he should go, and even when he is old, he will not depart from it.

7.hebrew: עָשִׁיר, בְּרָשִׁים יִמְשׁוֹל;    וְעֶבֶד לֹוֶה, לְאִישׁ מַלְוֶה.
7.english: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

8.hebrew: זוֹרֵעַ עַוְלָה, יקצור- (יִקְצָר-) אָוֶן;    וְשֵׁבֶט עֶבְרָתוֹ יִכְלֶה.
8.english: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity; and the rod of his wrath shall fail.

9.hebrew: טוֹב-עַיִן, הוּא יְבֹרָךְ:    כִּי-נָתַן מִלַּחְמוֹ לַדָּל.
9.english: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

10.hebrew: גָּרֵשׁ לֵץ, וְיֵצֵא מָדוֹן;    וְיִשְׁבֹּת, דִּין וְקָלוֹן.
10.english: Cast out the scorner, and contention will go out; yea, strife and shame will cease.

11.hebrew: אֹהֵב טהור- (טְהָר-) לֵב--    חֵן שְׂפָתָיו, רֵעֵהוּ מֶלֶךְ.
11.english: He that loveth pureness of heart, that hath grace in his lips, the king shall be his friend.

12.hebrew: עֵינֵי יְהוָה, נָצְרוּ דָעַת;    וַיְסַלֵּף, דִּבְרֵי בֹגֵד.
12.english: The eyes of the LORD preserve him that hath knowledge, but He overthroweth the words of the faithless man.

13.hebrew: אָמַר עָצֵל, אֲרִי בַחוּץ;    בְּתוֹךְ רְחֹבוֹת, אֵרָצֵחַ.
13.english: The sluggard saith: 'There is a lion without; I shall be slain in the streets.'

14.hebrew: שׁוּחָה עֲמֻקָּה, פִּי זָרוֹת;    זְעוּם יְהוָה, יפול- (יִפָּל-) שָׁם.
14.english: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

15.hebrew: אִוֶּלֶת, קְשׁוּרָה בְלֶב-נָעַר;    שֵׁבֶט מוּסָר, יַרְחִיקֶנָּה מִמֶּנּוּ.
15.english: Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

16.hebrew: עֹשֵׁק דָּל, לְהַרְבּוֹת לוֹ--    נֹתֵן לְעָשִׁיר, אַךְ-לְמַחְסוֹר.
16.english: One may oppress the poor, yet will their gain increase; one may give to the rich, yet will want come.

17.hebrew: הַט אָזְנְךָ--וּשְׁמַע, דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים;    וְלִבְּךָ, תָּשִׁית לְדַעְתִּי.
17.english: Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thy heart unto my knowledge.

18.hebrew: כִּי-נָעִים, כִּי-תִשְׁמְרֵם בְּבִטְנֶךָ;    יִכֹּנוּ יַחְדָּו, עַל-שְׂפָתֶיךָ.
18.english: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; let them be established altogether upon thy lips.

19.hebrew: לִהְיוֹת בַּיהוָה, מִבְטַחֶךָ--    הוֹדַעְתִּיךָ הַיּוֹם אַף-אָתָּה.
19.english: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee.

20.hebrew: הֲלֹא כָתַבְתִּי לְךָ, שלשום (שָׁלִשִׁים)--    בְּמֹעֵצוֹת וָדָעַת.
20.english: Have not I written unto thee excellent things of counsels and knowledge;

21.hebrew: לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ--קֹשְׁטְ, אִמְרֵי אֱמֶת;    לְהָשִׁיב אֲמָרִים אֱמֶת, לְשֹׁלְחֶיךָ.
21.english: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, that thou mightest bring back words of truth to them that send thee?

22.hebrew: אַל-תִּגְזָל-דָּל, כִּי דַל-הוּא;    וְאַל-תְּדַכֵּא עָנִי בַשָּׁעַר.
22.english: Rob not the weak, because he is weak, neither crush the poor in the gate;

23.hebrew: כִּי-יְהוָה, יָרִיב רִיבָם;    וְקָבַע אֶת-קֹבְעֵיהֶם נָפֶשׁ.
23.english: For the LORD will plead their cause, and despoil of life those that despoil them.

24.hebrew: אַל-תִּתְרַע, אֶת-בַּעַל אָף;    וְאֶת-אִישׁ חֵמוֹת, לֹא תָבוֹא.
24.english: Make no friendship with a man that is given to anger; and with a wrathful man thou shalt not go;

25.hebrew: פֶּן-תֶּאֱלַף אֹרְחֹתָו;    וְלָקַחְתָּ מוֹקֵשׁ לְנַפְשֶׁךָ.
25.english: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

26.hebrew: אַל-תְּהִי בְתֹקְעֵי-כָף;    בַּעֹרְבִים, מַשָּׁאוֹת.
26.english: Be thou not of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts;

27.hebrew: אִם-אֵין-לְךָ לְשַׁלֵּם--    לָמָּה יִקַּח מִשְׁכָּבְךָ, מִתַּחְתֶּיךָ.
27.english: If thou hast not wherewith to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

28.hebrew: אַל-תַּסֵּג, גְּבוּל עוֹלָם--    אֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ אֲבוֹתֶיךָ.
28.english: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

29.hebrew: חָזִיתָ אִישׁ, מָהִיר בִּמְלַאכְתּוֹ--    לִפְנֵי-מְלָכִים יִתְיַצָּב;בַּל-יִתְיַצֵּב,    לִפְנֵי חֲשֻׁכִּים.
29.english: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; {N}he shall not stand before mean men. {P}

1.hebrew: כִּי-תֵשֵׁב, לִלְחוֹם אֶת-מוֹשֵׁל--    בִּין תָּבִין, אֶת-אֲשֶׁר לְפָנֶיךָ.
1.english: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider well him that is before thee;

2.hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ שַׂכִּין בְּלֹעֶךָ--    אִם-בַּעַל נֶפֶשׁ אָתָּה.
2.english: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

3.hebrew: אַל-תִּתְאָו, לְמַטְעַמּוֹתָיו;    וְהוּא, לֶחֶם כְּזָבִים.
3.english: Be not desirous of his dainties; seeing they are deceitful food.

4.hebrew: אַל-תִּיגַע לְהַעֲשִׁיר;    מִבִּינָתְךָ חֲדָל.
4.english: Weary not thyself to be rich; cease from thine own wisdom.

5.hebrew: התעוף (הֲתָעִיף) עֵינֶיךָ בּוֹ,    וְאֵינֶנּוּ:כִּי עָשֹׂה יַעֲשֶׂה-לּוֹ כְנָפַיִם;    כְּנֶשֶׁר, ועיף (יָעוּף) הַשָּׁמָיִם.
5.english: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon it? it is gone; {N}for riches certainly make themselves wings, like an eagle that flieth toward heaven. {P}

6.hebrew: אַל-תִּלְחַם--אֶת-לֶחֶם, רַע עָיִן;    וְאַל-תִּתְאָו, לְמַטְעַמֹּתָיו.
6.english: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainties;

7.hebrew: כִּי, כְּמוֹ שָׁעַר בְּנַפְשׁוֹ--    כֶּן-הוּא:אֱכוֹל וּשְׁתֵה, יֹאמַר לָךְ;    וְלִבּוֹ, בַּל-עִמָּךְ.
7.english: For as one that hath reckoned within himself, so is he: {N}'Eat and drink', saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

8.hebrew: פִּתְּךָ-אָכַלְתָּ תְקִיאֶנָּה;    וְשִׁחַתָּ, דְּבָרֶיךָ הַנְּעִימִים.
8.english: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

9.hebrew: בְּאָזְנֵי כְסִיל, אַל-תְּדַבֵּר:    כִּי-יָבוּז, לְשֵׂכֶל מִלֶּיךָ.
9.english: Speak not in the ears of a fool; for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

10.hebrew: אַל-תַּסֵּג, גְּבוּל עוֹלָם;    וּבִשְׂדֵי יְתוֹמִים, אַל-תָּבֹא.
10.english: Remove not the ancient landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless;

11.hebrew: כִּי-גֹאֲלָם חָזָק;    הוּא-יָרִיב אֶת-רִיבָם אִתָּךְ.
11.english: For their Redeemer is strong; He will plead their cause with thee.

12.hebrew: הָבִיאָה לַמּוּסָר לִבֶּךָ;    וְאָזְנֶךָ, לְאִמְרֵי-דָעַת.
12.english: Apply thy heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

13.hebrew: אַל-תִּמְנַע מִנַּעַר מוּסָר:    כִּי-תַכֶּנּוּ בַשֵּׁבֶט, לֹא יָמוּת.
13.english: Withhold not correction from the child; for though thou beat him with the rod, he will not die.

14.hebrew: אַתָּה, בַּשֵּׁבֶט תַּכֶּנּוּ;    וְנַפְשׁוֹ, מִשְּׁאוֹל תַּצִּיל.
14.english: Thou beatest him with the rod, and wilt deliver his soul from the nether-world.

15.hebrew: בְּנִי, אִם-חָכַם לִבֶּךָ--    יִשְׂמַח לִבִּי גַם-אָנִי.
15.english: My son, if thy heart be wise, my heart will be glad, even mine;

16.hebrew: וְתַעְלֹזְנָה כִלְיוֹתָי--    בְּדַבֵּר שְׂפָתֶיךָ, מֵישָׁרִים.
16.english: Yea, my reins will rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

17.hebrew: אַל-יְקַנֵּא לִבְּךָ, בַּחַטָּאִים:    כִּי אִם-בְּיִרְאַת-יְהוָה, כָּל-הַיּוֹם.
17.english: Let not thy heart envy sinners, but be in the fear of the LORD all the day;

18.hebrew: כִּי, אִם-יֵשׁ אַחֲרִית;    וְתִקְוָתְךָ, לֹא תִכָּרֵת.
18.english: For surely there is a future; and thy hope shall not be cut off.

19.hebrew: שְׁמַע-אַתָּה בְנִי וַחֲכָם;    וְאַשֵּׁר בַּדֶּרֶךְ לִבֶּךָ.
19.english: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thy heart in the way.

20.hebrew: אַל-תְּהִי בְסֹבְאֵי-יָיִן--    בְּזֹלְלֵי בָשָׂר לָמוֹ.
20.english: Be not among winebibbers; among gluttonous eaters of flesh;

21.hebrew: כִּי-סֹבֵא וְזוֹלֵל, יִוָּרֵשׁ;    וּקְרָעִים, תַּלְבִּישׁ נוּמָה.
21.english: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty; and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

22.hebrew: שְׁמַע לְאָבִיךָ, זֶה יְלָדֶךָ;    וְאַל-תָּבוּז, כִּי-זָקְנָה אִמֶּךָ.
22.english: Hearken unto thy father that begot thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

23.hebrew: אֱמֶת קְנֵה, וְאַל-תִּמְכֹּר;    חָכְמָה וּמוּסָר וּבִינָה.
23.english: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

24.hebrew: גול (גִּיל) יָגִיל, אֲבִי צַדִּיק;    יולד (וְיוֹלֵד) חָכָם, וישמח- (יִשְׂמַח-) בּוֹ.
24.english: The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice; and he that begetteth a wise child will have joy of him.

25.hebrew: יִשְׂמַח-אָבִיךָ וְאִמֶּךָ;    וְתָגֵל, יוֹלַדְתֶּךָ.
25.english: Let thy father and thy mother be glad, and let her that bore thee rejoice.

26.hebrew: תְּנָה-בְנִי לִבְּךָ לִי;    וְעֵינֶיךָ, דְּרָכַי תרצנה (תִּצֹּרְנָה).
26.english: My son, give me thy heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

27.hebrew: כִּי-שׁוּחָה עֲמֻקָּה זוֹנָה;    וּבְאֵר צָרָה, נָכְרִיָּה.
27.english: For a harlot is a deep ditch; and an alien woman is a narrow pit.

28.hebrew: אַף-הִיא, כְּחֶתֶף תֶּאֱרֹב;    וּבוֹגְדִים, בְּאָדָם תּוֹסִף.
28.english: She also lieth in wait as a robber, and increaseth the faithless among men.

29.hebrew: לְמִי אוֹי לְמִי אֲבוֹי, לְמִי מדונים (מִדְיָנִים) לְמִי שִׂיחַ--    לְמִי, פְּצָעִים חִנָּם;לְמִי,    חַכְלִלוּת עֵינָיִם.
29.english: Who crieth: 'Woe'? who: 'Alas'? who hath contentions? who hath raving? who hath wounds without cause? {N}who hath redness of eyes?

30.english: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to try mixed wine.

31.hebrew: אַל-תֵּרֶא יַיִן, כִּי יִתְאַדָּם:    כִּי-יִתֵּן בכיס (בַּכּוֹס) עֵינוֹ; יִתְהַלֵּךְ, בְּמֵישָׁרִים.
31.english: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth its colour in the cup, when it glideth down smoothly;

32.english: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like a basilisk.

33.hebrew: עֵינֶיךָ, יִרְאוּ זָרוֹת;    וְלִבְּךָ, יְדַבֵּר תַּהְפֻּכוֹת.
33.english: Thine eyes shall behold strange things, and thy heart shall utter confused things.

34.hebrew: וְהָיִיתָ, כְּשֹׁכֵב בְּלֶב-יָם;    וּכְשֹׁכֵב, בְּרֹאשׁ חִבֵּל.
34.english: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

35.hebrew: הִכּוּנִי בַל-חָלִיתִי--    הֲלָמוּנִי, בַּל-יָדָעְתִּי:מָתַי אָקִיץ;    אוֹסִיף, אֲבַקְשֶׁנּוּ עוֹד.
35.english: 'They have struck me, and I felt it not, they have beaten me, and I knew it not; {N}when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.'

1.hebrew: אַל-תְּקַנֵּא, בְּאַנְשֵׁי רָעָה;    וְאַל-תִּתְאָו, לִהְיוֹת אִתָּם.
1.english: Be not thou envious of evil men, neither desire to be with them.

2.hebrew: כִּי-שֹׁד, יֶהְגֶּה לִבָּם;    וְעָמָל, שִׂפְתֵיהֶם תְּדַבֵּרְנָה.
2.english: For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.

3.hebrew: בְּחָכְמָה, יִבָּנֶה בָּיִת;    וּבִתְבוּנָה, יִתְכּוֹנָן.
3.english: Through wisdom is a house builded; and by understanding it is established;

4.hebrew: וּבְדַעַת, חֲדָרִים יִמָּלְאוּ--    כָּל-הוֹן יָקָר וְנָעִים.
4.english: And by knowledge are the chambers filled with all precious and pleasant riches.

5.hebrew: גֶּבֶר-חָכָם בַּעוֹז;    וְאִישׁ-דַּעַת, מְאַמֶּץ-כֹּחַ.
5.english: A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.

6.hebrew: כִּי בְתַחְבֻּלוֹת, תַּעֲשֶׂה-לְּךָ מִלְחָמָה;    וּתְשׁוּעָה, בְּרֹב יוֹעֵץ.
6.english: For with wise advice thou shalt make thy war; and in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

7.hebrew: רָאמוֹת לֶאֱוִיל חָכְמוֹת;    בַּשַּׁעַר, לֹא יִפְתַּח-פִּיהוּ.
7.english: Wisdom is as unattainable to a fool as corals; he openeth not his mouth in the gate.

8.hebrew: מְחַשֵּׁב לְהָרֵעַ--    לוֹ, בַּעַל-מְזִמּוֹת יִקְרָאוּ.
8.english: He that deviseth to do evil, men shall call him a mischievous person.

9.hebrew: זִמַּת אִוֶּלֶת חַטָּאת;    וְתוֹעֲבַת לְאָדָם לֵץ.
9.english: The thought of foolishness is sin; and the scorner is an abomination to men.

10.hebrew: הִתְרַפִּיתָ, בְּיוֹם צָרָה--    צַר כֹּחֶכָה.
10.english: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small indeed.

11.hebrew: הַצֵּל, לְקֻחִים לַמָּוֶת;    וּמָטִים לַהֶרֶג, אִם-תַּחְשׂוֹךְ.
11.english: Deliver them that are drawn unto death; and those that are ready to be slain wilt thou forbear to rescue?

12.hebrew: כִּי-תֹאמַר--    הֵן, לֹא-יָדַעְנוּ-זֶה:הֲלֹא-תֹכֵן לִבּוֹת, הוּא-יָבִין, וְנֹצֵר נַפְשְׁךָ, הוּא יֵדָע;    וְהֵשִׁיב לְאָדָם כְּפָעֳלוֹ.
12.english: If thou sayest: 'Behold, we knew not this', doth not He that weigheth the hearts consider it? And He that keepeth thy soul, doth not He know it? And shall not He render to every man according to his works?

13.hebrew: אֱכָל-בְּנִי דְבַשׁ כִּי-טוֹב;    וְנֹפֶת מָתוֹק, עַל-חִכֶּךָ.
13.english: My son, eat thou honey, for it is good, and the honeycomb is sweet to thy taste;

14.hebrew: כֵּן, דְּעֶה חָכְמָה--לְנַפְשֶׁךָ:    אִם-מָצָאתָ, וְיֵשׁ אַחֲרִית; וְתִקְוָתְךָ, לֹא תִכָּרֵת.
14.english: So know thou wisdom to be unto thy soul; if thou hast found it, then shall there be a future, and thy hope shall not be cut off. {P}

15.hebrew: אַל-תֶּאֱרֹב רָשָׁע, לִנְוֵה צַדִּיק;    אַל-תְּשַׁדֵּד רִבְצוֹ.
15.english: Lie not in wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous, spoil not his resting-place;

16.hebrew: כִּי שֶׁבַע, יִפּוֹל צַדִּיק וָקָם;    וּרְשָׁעִים, יִכָּשְׁלוּ בְרָעָה.
16.english: For a righteous man falleth seven times, and riseth up again, but the wicked stumble under adversity.

17.hebrew: בִּנְפֹל אויביך (אוֹיִבְךָ), אַל-תִּשְׂמָח;    וּבִכָּשְׁלוֹ, אַל-יָגֵל לִבֶּךָ.
17.english: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thy heart be glad when he stumbleth;

18.hebrew: פֶּן-יִרְאֶה יְהוָה, וְרַע בְּעֵינָיו;    וְהֵשִׁיב מֵעָלָיו אַפּוֹ.
18.english: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease Him, and He turn away His wrath from him. {P}

19.hebrew: אַל-תִּתְחַר בַּמְּרֵעִים;    אַל-תְּקַנֵּא, בָּרְשָׁעִים.
19.english: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious at the wicked;

20.hebrew: כִּי, לֹא-תִהְיֶה אַחֲרִית לָרָע;    נֵר רְשָׁעִים יִדְעָךְ.
20.english: For there will be no future to the evil man, the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

21.hebrew: יְרָא-אֶת-יְהוָה בְּנִי וָמֶלֶךְ;    עִם-שׁוֹנִים, אַל-תִּתְעָרָב.
21.english: My son, fear thou the LORD and the king, and meddle not with them that are given to change;

22.hebrew: כִּי-פִתְאֹם, יָקוּם אֵידָם;    וּפִיד שְׁנֵיהֶם, מִי יוֹדֵעַ.
22.english: For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin from them both? {P}

23.hebrew: גַּם-אֵלֶּה לַחֲכָמִים:    הַכֵּר-פָּנִים בְּמִשְׁפָּט בַּל-טוֹב.
23.english: These also are sayings of the wise. To have respect of persons in judgment is not good.

24.hebrew: אֹמֵר, לְרָשָׁע--צַדִּיק אָתָּה:    יִקְּבֻהוּ עַמִּים; יִזְעָמוּהוּ לְאֻמִּים.
24.english: He that saith unto the wicked: 'Thou art righteous', peoples shall curse him, nations shall execrate him;

25.hebrew: וְלַמּוֹכִיחִים יִנְעָם;    וַעֲלֵיהֶם, תָּבוֹא בִרְכַּת-טוֹב.
25.english: But to them that decide justly shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.

26.hebrew: שְׂפָתַיִם יִשָּׁק;    מֵשִׁיב, דְּבָרִים נְכֹחִים.
26.english: He kisseth the lips that giveth a right answer.

27.hebrew: הָכֵן בַּחוּץ, מְלַאכְתֶּךָ--וְעַתְּדָהּ בַּשָּׂדֶה לָךְ;    אַחַר, וּבָנִיתָ בֵיתֶךָ.
27.english: Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thy house. {P}

28.hebrew: אַל-תְּהִי עֵד-חִנָּם בְּרֵעֶךָ;    וַהֲפִתִּיתָ, בִּשְׂפָתֶיךָ.
28.english: Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.

29.hebrew: אַל-תֹּאמַר--כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה-לִי, כֵּן אֶעֱשֶׂה-לּוֹ;    אָשִׁיב לָאִישׁ כְּפָעֳלוֹ.
29.english: Say not: 'I will do so to him as he hath done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.' {P}

30.hebrew: עַל-שְׂדֵה אִישׁ-עָצֵל עָבַרְתִּי;    וְעַל-כֶּרֶם, אָדָם חֲסַר-לֵב.
30.english: I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;

31.hebrew: וְהִנֵּה עָלָה כֻלּוֹ, קִמְּשֹׂנִים--כָּסּוּ פָנָיו חֲרֻלִּים;    וְגֶדֶר אֲבָנָיו נֶהֱרָסָה.
31.english: And, lo, it was all grown over with thistles, the face thereof was covered with nettles, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.

32.hebrew: וָאֶחֱזֶה אָנֹכִי, אָשִׁית לִבִּי;    רָאִיתִי, לָקַחְתִּי מוּסָר.
32.english: Then I beheld, and considered well; I saw, and received instruction.

33.hebrew: מְעַט שֵׁנוֹת, מְעַט תְּנוּמוֹת;    מְעַט, חִבֻּק יָדַיִם לִשְׁכָּב.
33.english: 'Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep'--

34.english: So shall thy poverty come as a runner, and thy want as an armed man. {P}

1.hebrew: גַּם-אֵלֶּה, מִשְׁלֵי שְׁלֹמֹה--    אֲשֶׁר הֶעְתִּיקוּ, אַנְשֵׁי חִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה.
1.english: These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

2.hebrew: כְּבֹד אֱלֹהִים, הַסְתֵּר דָּבָר;    וּכְבֹד מְלָכִים, חֲקֹר דָּבָר.
2.english: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing; but the glory of kings is to search out a matter.

3.hebrew: שָׁמַיִם לָרוּם, וָאָרֶץ לָעֹמֶק;    וְלֵב מְלָכִים, אֵין חֵקֶר.
3.english: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

4.hebrew: הָגוֹ סִיגִים מִכָּסֶף;    וַיֵּצֵא לַצֹּרֵף כֶּלִי.
4.english: Take away the dross from the silver, and there cometh forth a vessel for the refiner;

5.hebrew: הָגוֹ רָשָׁע, לִפְנֵי-מֶלֶךְ;    וְיִכּוֹן בַּצֶּדֶק כִּסְאוֹ.
5.english: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

6.hebrew: אַל-תִּתְהַדַּר לִפְנֵי-מֶלֶךְ;    וּבִמְקוֹם גְּדֹלִים, אַל-תַּעֲמֹד.
6.english: Glorify not thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men;

7.hebrew: כִּי טוֹב אֲמָר-לְךָ, עֲלֵה-הֵנָּה:    מֵהַשְׁפִּילְךָ, לִפְנֵי נָדִיב--אֲשֶׁר רָאוּ עֵינֶיךָ.
7.english: For better is it that it be said unto thee: 'Come up hither', than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince, whom thine eyes have seen.

8.hebrew: אַל-תֵּצֵא לָרִב, מַהֵר:    פֶּן מַה-תַּעֲשֶׂה, בְּאַחֲרִיתָהּ--בְּהַכְלִים אֹתְךָ רֵעֶךָ.
8.english: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

9.hebrew: רִיבְךָ, רִיב אֶת-רֵעֶךָ;    וְסוֹד אַחֵר אַל-תְּגָל.
9.english: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour, but reveal not the secret of another;

10.hebrew: פֶּן-יְחַסֶּדְךָ שֹׁמֵעַ;    וְדִבָּתְךָ, לֹא תָשׁוּב.
10.english: Lest he that heareth it revile thee, and thine infamy turn not away.

11.hebrew: תַּפּוּחֵי זָהָב, בְּמַשְׂכִּיּוֹת כָּסֶף--    דָּבָר, דָּבֻר עַל-אָפְנָיו.
11.english: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.

12.hebrew: נֶזֶם זָהָב, וַחֲלִי-כָתֶם--    מוֹכִיחַ חָכָם, עַל-אֹזֶן שֹׁמָעַת.
12.english: As an ear-ring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

13.hebrew: כְּצִנַּת שֶׁלֶג, בְּיוֹם קָצִיר--צִיר נֶאֱמָן, לְשֹׁלְחָיו;    וְנֶפֶשׁ אֲדֹנָיו יָשִׁיב.
13.english: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to him that sendeth him; for he refresheth the soul of his master. {P}

14.hebrew: נְשִׂיאִים וְרוּחַ, וְגֶשֶׁם אָיִן--    אִישׁ מִתְהַלֵּל, בְּמַתַּת-שָׁקֶר.
14.english: As vapours and wind without rain, so is he that boasteth himself of a false gift.

15.hebrew: בְּאֹרֶךְ אַפַּיִם, יְפֻתֶּה קָצִין;    וְלָשׁוֹן רַכָּה, תִּשְׁבָּר-גָּרֶם.
15.english: By long forbearing is a ruler persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

16.hebrew: דְּבַשׁ מָצָאתָ, אֱכֹל דַּיֶּךָּ:    פֶּן-תִּשְׂבָּעֶנּוּ, וַהֲקֵאתוֹ.
16.english: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

17.hebrew: הֹקַר רַגְלְךָ, מִבֵּית רֵעֶךָ:    פֶּן-יִשְׂבָּעֲךָ, וּשְׂנֵאֶךָ.
17.english: Let thy foot be seldom in thy neighbour's house; lest he be sated with thee, and hate thee.

18.hebrew: מֵפִיץ וְחֶרֶב, וְחֵץ שָׁנוּן--    אִישׁ עֹנֶה בְרֵעֵהוּ, עֵד שָׁקֶר.
18.english: As a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow, so is a man that beareth false witness against his neighbour.

19.hebrew: שֵׁן רֹעָה, וְרֶגֶל מוּעָדֶת--    מִבְטָח בּוֹגֵד, בְּיוֹם צָרָה.
19.english: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

20.hebrew: מַעֲדֶה-בֶּגֶד, בְּיוֹם קָרָה--חֹמֶץ עַל-נָתֶר;    וְשָׁר בַּשִּׁרִים, עַל לֶב-רָע.
20.english: As one that taketh off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to a heavy heart. {P}

21.hebrew: אִם-רָעֵב שֹׂנַאֲךָ, הַאֲכִלֵהוּ לָחֶם;    וְאִם-צָמֵא, הַשְׁקֵהוּ מָיִם.
21.english: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat, and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink;

22.hebrew: כִּי גֶחָלִים--אַתָּה, חֹתֶה עַל-רֹאשׁוֹ;    וַיהוָה, יְשַׁלֶּם-לָךְ.
22.english: For thou wilt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD will reward thee.

23.hebrew: רוּחַ צָפוֹן, תְּחוֹלֵל גָּשֶׁם;    וּפָנִים נִזְעָמִים, לְשׁוֹן סָתֶר.
23.english: The north wind bringeth forth rain, and a backbiting tongue an angry countenance.

24.hebrew: טוֹב, שֶׁבֶת עַל-פִּנַּת-גָּג--    מֵאֵשֶׁת מדונים (מִדְיָנִים), וּבֵית חָבֶר.
24.english: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than in a house in common with a contentious woman.

25.hebrew: מַיִם קָרִים, עַל-נֶפֶשׁ עֲיֵפָה;    וּשְׁמוּעָה טוֹבָה, מֵאֶרֶץ מֶרְחָק.
25.english: As cold waters to a faint soul, so is good news from a far country.

26.hebrew: מַעְיָן נִרְפָּשׂ, וּמָקוֹר מָשְׁחָת--    צַדִּיק, מָט לִפְנֵי-רָשָׁע.
26.english: As a troubled fountain, and a corrupted spring, so is a righteous man that giveth way before the wicked.

27.hebrew: אָכֹל דְּבַשׁ הַרְבּוֹת לֹא-טוֹב;    וְחֵקֶר כְּבֹדָם כָּבוֹד.
27.english: It is not good to eat much honey; so for men to search out their own glory is not glory.

28.hebrew: עִיר פְּרוּצָה, אֵין חוֹמָה--    אִישׁ, אֲשֶׁר אֵין מַעְצָר לְרוּחוֹ.
28.english: Like a city broken down and without a wall, so is he whose spirit is without restraint.

1.hebrew: כַּשֶּׁלֶג, בַּקַּיִץ--וְכַמָּטָר בַּקָּצִיר:    כֵּן לֹא-נָאוֶה לִכְסִיל כָּבוֹד.
1.english: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

2.hebrew: כַּצִּפּוֹר לָנוּד, כַּדְּרוֹר לָעוּף--    כֵּן קִלְלַת חִנָּם, לא (לוֹ) תָבֹא.
2.english: As the wandering sparrow, as the flying swallow, so the curse that is causeless shall come home.

3.hebrew: שׁוֹט לַסּוּס, מֶתֶג לַחֲמוֹר;    וְשֵׁבֶט, לְגֵו כְּסִילִים.
3.english: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the back of fools.

4.hebrew: אַל-תַּעַן כְּסִיל, כְּאִוַּלְתּוֹ:    פֶּן-תִּשְׁוֶה-לּוֹ גַם-אָתָּה.
4.english: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

5.hebrew: עֲנֵה כְסִיל, כְּאִוַּלְתּוֹ:    פֶּן-יִהְיֶה חָכָם בְּעֵינָיו.
5.english: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own eyes.

6.hebrew: מְקַצֶּה רַגְלַיִם, חָמָס שֹׁתֶה--    שֹׁלֵחַ דְּבָרִים בְּיַד-כְּסִיל.
6.english: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off his own feet, and drinketh damage.

7.hebrew: דַּלְיוּ שֹׁקַיִם, מִפִּסֵּחַ;    וּמָשָׁל, בְּפִי כְסִילִים.
7.english: The legs hang limp from the lame; so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

8.hebrew: כִּצְרוֹר אֶבֶן, בְּמַרְגֵּמָה--    כֵּן-נוֹתֵן לִכְסִיל כָּבוֹד.
8.english: As a small stone in a heap of stones, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.

9.hebrew: חוֹחַ, עָלָה בְיַד-שִׁכּוֹר;    וּמָשָׁל, בְּפִי כְסִילִים.
9.english: As a thorn that cometh into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

10.hebrew: רַב מְחוֹלֵל-כֹּל;    וְשֹׂכֵר כְּסִיל, וְשֹׂכֵר עֹבְרִים.
10.english: A master performeth all things; but he that stoppeth a fool is as one that stoppeth a flood.

11.hebrew: כְּכֶלֶב, שָׁב עַל-קֵאוֹ--    כְּסִיל, שׁוֹנֶה בְאִוַּלְתּוֹ.
11.english: As a dog that returneth to his vomit, so is a fool that repeateth his folly.

12.hebrew: רָאִיתָ--אִישׁ, חָכָם בְּעֵינָיו:    תִּקְוָה לִכְסִיל מִמֶּנּוּ.
12.english: Seest thou a man wise in his own eyes? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

13.hebrew: אָמַר עָצֵל, שַׁחַל בַּדָּרֶךְ;    אֲרִי, בֵּין הָרְחֹבוֹת.
13.english: The sluggard saith: 'There is a lion in the way; yea, a lion is in the streets.'

14.hebrew: הַדֶּלֶת, תִּסּוֹב עַל-צִירָהּ;    וְעָצֵל, עַל-מִטָּתוֹ.
14.english: The door is turning upon its hinges, and the sluggard is still upon his bed.

15.hebrew: טָמַן עָצֵל יָדוֹ, בַּצַּלָּחַת;    נִלְאָה, לַהֲשִׁיבָהּ אֶל-פִּיו.
15.english: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish; it wearieth him to bring it back to his mouth.

16.hebrew: חָכָם עָצֵל בְּעֵינָיו--    מִשִּׁבְעָה, מְשִׁיבֵי טָעַם.
16.english: The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men that give wise answer.

17.hebrew: מַחֲזִיק בְּאָזְנֵי-כָלֶב--    עֹבֵר מִתְעַבֵּר, עַל-רִיב לֹּא-לוֹ.
17.english: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife not his own, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

18.hebrew: כְּמִתְלַהְלֵהַּ, הַיֹּרֶה זִקִּים--    חִצִּים וָמָוֶת.
18.english: As a madman who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death;

19.hebrew: כֵּן-אִישׁ, רִמָּה אֶת-רֵעֵהוּ;    וְאָמַר, הֲלֹא-מְשַׂחֵק אָנִי.
19.english: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith: 'Am not I in sport?'

20.hebrew: בְּאֶפֶס עֵצִים, תִּכְבֶּה-אֵשׁ;    וּבְאֵין נִרְגָּן, יִשְׁתֹּק מָדוֹן.
20.english: Where no wood is, the fire goeth out; and where there is no whisperer, contention ceaseth.

21.hebrew: פֶּחָם לְגֶחָלִים, וְעֵצִים לְאֵשׁ;    וְאִישׁ מדונים (מִדְיָנִים), לְחַרְחַר-רִיב.
21.english: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife. {P}

22.hebrew: דִּבְרֵי נִרְגָּן, כְּמִתְלַהֲמִים;    וְהֵם, יָרְדוּ חַדְרֵי-בָטֶן.
22.english: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the body.

23.hebrew: כֶּסֶף סִיגִים, מְצֻפֶּה עַל-חָרֶשׂ--    שְׂפָתַיִם דֹּלְקִים וְלֶב-רָע.
23.english: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like an earthen vessel overlaid with silver dross.

24.hebrew: בִּשְׂפָתָו, יִנָּכֵר שׂוֹנֵא;    וּבְקִרְבּוֹ, יָשִׁית מִרְמָה.
24.english: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, but he layeth up deceit within him.

25.hebrew: כִּי-יְחַנֵּן קוֹלוֹ, אַל-תַּאֲמֶן-בּוֹ:    כִּי שֶׁבַע תּוֹעֵבוֹת בְּלִבּוֹ.
25.english: When he speaketh fair, believe him not; for there are seven abominations in his heart.

26.hebrew: תִּכַּסֶּה שִׂנְאָה, בְּמַשָּׁאוֹן;    תִּגָּלֶה רָעָתוֹ בְקָהָל.
26.english: Though his hatred be concealed with deceit, his wickedness shall be revealed before the congregation.

27.hebrew: כֹּרֶה-שַּׁחַת, בָּהּ יִפּוֹל;    וְגוֹלֵל אֶבֶן, אֵלָיו תָּשׁוּב.
27.english: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein; and he that rolleth a stone, it shall return upon him.

28.hebrew: לְשׁוֹן-שֶׁקֶר, יִשְׂנָא דַכָּיו;    וּפֶה חָלָק, יַעֲשֶׂה מִדְחֶה.
28.english: A lying tongue hateth those that are crushed by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.

1.hebrew: אַל-תִּתְהַלֵּל, בְּיוֹם מָחָר:    כִּי לֹא-תֵדַע, מַה-יֵּלֶד יוֹם.
1.english: Boast not thyself of to-morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

2.hebrew: יְהַלֶּלְךָ זָר וְלֹא-פִיךָ;    נָכְרִי, וְאַל-שְׂפָתֶיךָ.
2.english: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

3.hebrew: כֹּבֶד-אֶבֶן, וְנֵטֶל הַחוֹל;    וְכַעַס אֱוִיל, כָּבֵד מִשְּׁנֵיהֶם.
3.english: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool's vexation is heavier than they both.

4.hebrew: אַכְזְרִיּוּת חֵמָה, וְשֶׁטֶף אָף;    וּמִי יַעֲמֹד, לִפְנֵי קִנְאָה.
4.english: Wrath is cruel, and anger is overwhelming; but who is able to stand before jealousy?

5.hebrew: טוֹבָה, תּוֹכַחַת מְגֻלָּה--    מֵאַהֲבָה מְסֻתָּרֶת.
5.english: Better is open rebuke than love that is hidden.

6.hebrew: נֶאֱמָנִים, פִּצְעֵי אוֹהֵב;    וְנַעְתָּרוֹת, נְשִׁיקוֹת שׂוֹנֵא.
6.english: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are importunate.

7.hebrew: נֶפֶשׁ שְׂבֵעָה, תָּבוּס נֹפֶת;    וְנֶפֶשׁ רְעֵבָה, כָּל-מַר מָתוֹק.
7.english: The full soul loatheth a honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

8.hebrew: כְּצִפּוֹר, נוֹדֶדֶת מִן-קִנָּהּ--    כֵּן-אִישׁ, נוֹדֵד מִמְּקוֹמוֹ.
8.english: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.

9.hebrew: שֶׁמֶן וּקְטֹרֶת, יְשַׂמַּח-לֵב;    וּמֶתֶק רֵעֵהוּ, מֵעֲצַת-נָפֶשׁ.
9.english: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart; so doth the sweetness of a man's friend by hearty counsel.

10.hebrew: רֵעֲךָ ורעה (וְרֵעַ) אָבִיךָ, אַל-תַּעֲזֹב--    וּבֵית אָחִיךָ, אַל-תָּבוֹא בְּיוֹם אֵידֶךָ;טוֹב שָׁכֵן קָרוֹב,    מֵאָח רָחוֹק.
10.english: Thine own friend, and thy father's friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother's house in the day of thy calamity; {N}better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

11.hebrew: חֲכַם בְּנִי, וְשַׂמַּח לִבִּי;    וְאָשִׁיבָה חֹרְפִי דָבָר.
11.english: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that taunteth me.

12.hebrew: עָרוּם, רָאָה רָעָה נִסְתָּר;    פְּתָאיִם, עָבְרוּ נֶעֱנָשׁוּ.
12.english: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the thoughtless pass on, and are punished.

13.hebrew: קַח-בִּגְדוֹ, כִּי-עָרַב זָר;    וּבְעַד נָכְרִיָּה חַבְלֵהוּ.
13.english: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; and hold him in pledge that is surety for an alien woman.

14.hebrew: מְבָרֵךְ רֵעֵהוּ, בְּקוֹל גָּדוֹל--בַּבֹּקֶר הַשְׁכֵּים:    קְלָלָה, תֵּחָשֶׁב לוֹ.
14.english: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

15.hebrew: דֶּלֶף טוֹרֵד, בְּיוֹם סַגְרִיר;    וְאֵשֶׁת מדונים (מִדְיָנִים), נִשְׁתָּוָה.
15.english: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike;

16.hebrew: צֹפְנֶיהָ צָפַן-רוּחַ;    וְשֶׁמֶן יְמִינוֹ יִקְרָא.
16.english: He that would hide her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand betrayeth itself.

17.hebrew: בַּרְזֶל בְּבַרְזֶל יָחַד;    וְאִישׁ, יַחַד פְּנֵי-רֵעֵהוּ.
17.english: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

18.hebrew: נֹצֵר תְּאֵנָה, יֹאכַל פִּרְיָהּ;    וְשֹׁמֵר אֲדֹנָיו יְכֻבָּד.
18.english: Whoso keepeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof; and he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.

19.hebrew: כַּמַּיִם, הַפָּנִים לַפָּנִים--    כֵּן לֵב-הָאָדָם, לָאָדָם.
19.english: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

20.hebrew: שְׁאוֹל וַאֲבַדֹּה, לֹא תִשְׂבַּעְנָה;    וְעֵינֵי הָאָדָם, לֹא תִשְׂבַּעְנָה.
20.english: The nether-world and Destruction are never satiated; so the eyes of man are never satiated.

21.hebrew: מַצְרֵף לַכֶּסֶף, וְכוּר לַזָּהָב;    וְאִישׁ, לְפִי מַהֲלָלוֹ.
21.english: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, and a man is tried by his praise.

22.hebrew: אִם תִּכְתּוֹשׁ-אֶת-הָאֱוִיל, בַּמַּכְתֵּשׁ בְּתוֹךְ הָרִיפוֹת--    בַּעֱלִי:לֹא-תָסוּר מֵעָלָיו,    אִוַּלְתּוֹ.
22.english: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar with a pestle among groats, {N}yet will not his foolishness depart from him. {P}

23.hebrew: יָדֹעַ תֵּדַע, פְּנֵי צֹאנֶךָ;    שִׁית לִבְּךָ, לַעֲדָרִים.
23.english: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds;

24.hebrew: כִּי לֹא לְעוֹלָם חֹסֶן;    וְאִם-נֵזֶר, לְדוֹר דור (וָדוֹר).
24.english: For riches are not for ever; and doth the crown endure unto all generations?

25.hebrew: גָּלָה חָצִיר, וְנִרְאָה-דֶשֶׁא;    וְנֶאֶסְפוּ, עִשְּׂבוֹת הָרִים.
25.english: When the hay is mown, and the tender grass showeth itself, and the herbs of the mountains are gathered in;

26.hebrew: כְּבָשִׂים לִלְבוּשֶׁךָ;    וּמְחִיר שָׂדֶה, עַתּוּדִים.
26.english: The lambs will be for thy clothing, and the goats the price for a field.

27.hebrew: וְדֵי, חֲלֵב עִזִּים--לְלַחְמְךָ, לְלֶחֶם בֵּיתֶךָ;    וְחַיִּים, לְנַעֲרוֹתֶיךָ.
27.english: And there will be goats' milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household; and maintenance for thy maidens.

1.hebrew: נָסוּ וְאֵין-רֹדֵף רָשָׁע;    וְצַדִּיקִים, כִּכְפִיר יִבְטָח.
1.english: The wicked flee when no man pursueth; but the righteous are secure as a young lion.

2.hebrew: בְּפֶשַׁע אֶרֶץ, רַבִּים שָׂרֶיהָ;    וּבְאָדָם מֵבִין יֹדֵעַ, כֵּן יַאֲרִיךְ.
2.english: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof; but by a man of understanding and knowledge established order shall long continue.

3.hebrew: גֶּבֶר-רָשׁ, וְעֹשֵׁק דַּלִּים--    מָטָר סֹחֵף, וְאֵין לָחֶם.
3.english: A poor man that oppresseth the weak is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

4.hebrew: עֹזְבֵי תוֹרָה, יְהַלְלוּ רָשָׁע;    וְשֹׁמְרֵי תוֹרָה, יִתְגָּרוּ בָם.
4.english: They that forsake the law praise the wicked; but such as keep the law contend with them.

5.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי-רָע, לֹא-יָבִינוּ מִשְׁפָּט;    וּמְבַקְשֵׁי יְהוָה, יָבִינוּ כֹל.
5.english: Evil men understand not justice; but they that seek the LORD understand all things.

6.hebrew: טוֹב-רָשׁ, הוֹלֵךְ בְּתֻמּוֹ--    מֵעִקֵּשׁ דְּרָכַיִם, וְהוּא עָשִׁיר.
6.english: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.

7.hebrew: נוֹצֵר תּוֹרָה, בֵּן מֵבִין;    וְרֹעֶה זוֹלְלִים, יַכְלִים אָבִיו.
7.english: A wise son observeth the teaching; but he that is a companion of gluttonous men shameth his father.

8.hebrew: מַרְבֶּה הוֹנוֹ, בְּנֶשֶׁךְ ובתרבית (וְתַרְבִּית)--    לְחוֹנֵן דַּלִּים יִקְבְּצֶנּוּ.
8.english: He that augmenteth his substance by interest and increase, gathereth it for him that is gracious to the poor.

9.hebrew: מֵסִיר אָזְנוֹ, מִשְּׁמֹעַ תּוֹרָה--    גַּם תְּפִלָּתוֹ, תּוֹעֵבָה.
9.english: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer is an abomination.

10.hebrew: מַשְׁגֶּה יְשָׁרִים, בְּדֶרֶךְ רָע--בִּשְׁחוּתוֹ הוּא-יִפּוֹל;    וּתְמִימִים, יִנְחֲלוּ-טוֹב.
10.english: Whoso causeth the upright to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit; but the whole-hearted shall inherit good. {P}

11.hebrew: חָכָם בְּעֵינָיו, אִישׁ עָשִׁיר;    וְדַל מֵבִין יַחְקְרֶנּוּ.
11.english: The rich man is wise in his own eyes; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him through.

12.hebrew: בַּעֲלֹץ צַדִּיקִים, רַבָּה תִפְאָרֶת;    וּבְקוּם רְשָׁעִים, יְחֻפַּשׂ אָדָם.
12.english: When the righteous exult, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, men must be sought for.

13.hebrew: מְכַסֶּה פְשָׁעָיו, לֹא יַצְלִיחַ;    וּמוֹדֶה וְעֹזֵב יְרֻחָם.
13.english: He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper; but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall obtain mercy.

14.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם, מְפַחֵד תָּמִיד;    וּמַקְשֶׁה לִבּוֹ, יִפּוֹל בְּרָעָה.
14.english: Happy is the man that feareth alway; but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into evil.

15.hebrew: אֲרִי-נֹהֵם, וְדֹב שׁוֹקֵק--    מוֹשֵׁל רָשָׁע, עַל עַם-דָּל.
15.english: As a roaring lion, and a ravenous bear; so is a wicked ruler over a poor people.

16.hebrew: נָגִיד--חֲסַר תְּבוּנוֹת, וְרַב מַעֲשַׁקּוֹת;    שנאי (שֹׂנֵא) בֶצַע, יַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים.
16.english: The prince that lacketh understanding is also a great oppressor; but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days. {P}

17.hebrew: אָדָם, עָשֻׁק בְּדַם-נָפֶשׁ--    עַד-בּוֹר יָנוּס, אַל-יִתְמְכוּ-בוֹ.
17.english: A man that is laden with the blood of any person shall hasten his steps unto the pit; none will support him.

18.hebrew: הוֹלֵךְ תָּמִים, יִוָּשֵׁעַ;    וְנֶעְקַשׁ דְּרָכַיִם, יִפּוֹל בְּאֶחָת.
18.english: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved; but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.

19.hebrew: עֹבֵד אַדְמָתוֹ, יִשְׂבַּע-לָחֶם;    וּמְרַדֵּף רֵיקִים, יִשְׂבַּע-רִישׁ.
19.english: He that tilleth his ground shall have plenty of bread; but he that followeth after vain things shall have poverty enough.

20.hebrew: אִישׁ אֱמוּנוֹת, רַב-בְּרָכוֹת;    וְאָץ לְהַעֲשִׁיר, לֹא יִנָּקֶה.
20.english: A faithful man shall abound with blessings; but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be unpunished.

21.hebrew: הַכֵּר-פָּנִים לֹא-טוֹב;    וְעַל-פַּת-לֶחֶם, יִפְשַׁע-גָּבֶר.
21.english: To have respect of persons is not good; for a man will transgress for a piece of bread.

22.hebrew: נִבְהָל לַהוֹן--אִישׁ, רַע עָיִן;    וְלֹא-יֵדַע, כִּי-חֶסֶר יְבֹאֶנּוּ.
22.english: He that hath an evil eye hasteneth after riches, and knoweth not that want shall come upon him.

23.hebrew: מוֹכִיחַ אָדָם אַחֲרַי, חֵן יִמְצָא--    מִמַּחֲלִיק לָשׁוֹן.
23.english: He that rebuketh a man shall in the end find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

24.hebrew: גּוֹזֵל, אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ--וְאֹמֵר אֵין-פָּשַׁע:    חָבֵר הוּא, לְאִישׁ מַשְׁחִית.
24.english: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith: 'It is no transgression', the same is the companion of a destroyer.

25.hebrew: רְחַב-נֶפֶשׁ, יְגָרֶה מָדוֹן;    וּבֹטֵחַ עַל-יְהוָה יְדֻשָּׁן.
25.english: He that is of a greedy spirit stirreth up strife; but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be abundantly gratified.

26.hebrew: בּוֹטֵחַ בְּלִבּוֹ, הוּא כְסִיל;    וְהוֹלֵךְ בְּחָכְמָה, הוּא יִמָּלֵט.
26.english: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool; but whoso walketh wisely, he shall escape.

27.hebrew: נוֹתֵן לָרָשׁ, אֵין מַחְסוֹר;    וּמַעְלִים עֵינָיו, רַב-מְאֵרוֹת.
27.english: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack; but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.

28.hebrew: בְּקוּם רְשָׁעִים, יִסָּתֵר אָדָם;    וּבְאָבְדָם, יִרְבּוּ צַדִּיקִים.
28.english: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves; but when they perish, the righteous increase.

1.hebrew: אִישׁ תּוֹכָחוֹת, מַקְשֶׁה-עֹרֶף--    פֶּתַע יִשָּׁבֵר, וְאֵין מַרְפֵּא.
1.english: He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck shall suddenly be broken, and that without remedy.

2.hebrew: בִּרְבוֹת צַדִּיקִים, יִשְׂמַח הָעָם;    וּבִמְשֹׁל רָשָׁע, יֵאָנַח עָם.
2.english: When the righteous are increased, the people rejoice; but when the wicked beareth rule, the people sigh.

3.hebrew: אִישׁ-אֹהֵב חָכְמָה, יְשַׂמַּח אָבִיו;    וְרֹעֶה זוֹנוֹת, יְאַבֶּד-הוֹן.
3.english: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father; but he that keepeth company with harlots wasteth his substance.

4.hebrew: מֶלֶךְ--בְּמִשְׁפָּט, יַעֲמִיד אָרֶץ;    וְאִישׁ תְּרוּמוֹת יֶהֶרְסֶנָּה.
4.english: The king by justice establisheth the land; but he that exacteth gifts overthroweth it.

5.hebrew: גֶּבֶר, מַחֲלִיק עַל-רֵעֵהוּ;    רֶשֶׁת, פּוֹרֵשׂ עַל-פְּעָמָיו.
5.english: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his steps.

6.hebrew: בְּפֶשַׁע אִישׁ רָע מוֹקֵשׁ;    וְצַדִּיק, יָרוּן וְשָׂמֵחַ.
6.english: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare; but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

7.hebrew: יֹדֵעַ צַדִּיק, דִּין דַּלִּים;    רָשָׁע, לֹא-יָבִין דָּעַת.
7.english: The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor; the wicked understandeth not knowledge.

8.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי לָצוֹן, יָפִיחוּ קִרְיָה;    וַחֲכָמִים, יָשִׁיבוּ אָף.
8.english: Scornful men set a city in a blaze; but wise men turn away wrath.

9.hebrew: אִישׁ-חָכָם--נִשְׁפָּט, אֶת-אִישׁ אֱוִיל:    וְרָגַז וְשָׂחַק, וְאֵין נָחַת.
9.english: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he be angry or laugh, there will be no rest.

10.hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי דָמִים, יִשְׂנְאוּ-תָם;    וִישָׁרִים, יְבַקְשׁוּ נַפְשׁוֹ.
10.english: The men of blood hate him that is sincere; and as for the upright, they seek his life.

11.hebrew: כָּל-רוּחוֹ, יוֹצִיא כְסִיל;    וְחָכָם, בְּאָחוֹר יְשַׁבְּחֶנָּה.
11.english: A fool spendeth all his spirit; but a wise man stilleth it within him.

12.hebrew: מֹשֵׁל, מַקְשִׁיב עַל-דְּבַר-שָׁקֶר--    כָּל-מְשָׁרְתָיו רְשָׁעִים.
12.english: If a ruler hearkeneth to falsehood, all his servants are wicked.

13.hebrew: רָשׁ וְאִישׁ תְּכָכִים נִפְגָּשׁוּ--    מֵאִיר עֵינֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם יְהוָה.
13.english: The poor man and the oppressor meet together; the LORD giveth light to the eyes of them both.

14.hebrew: מֶלֶךְ שׁוֹפֵט בֶּאֱמֶת דַּלִּים--    כִּסְאוֹ, לָעַד יִכּוֹן.
14.english: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

15.hebrew: שֵׁבֶט וְתוֹכַחַת, יִתֵּן חָכְמָה;    וְנַעַר מְשֻׁלָּח, מֵבִישׁ אִמּוֹ.
15.english: The rod and reproof give wisdom; but a child left to himself causeth shame to his mother.

16.hebrew: בִּרְבוֹת רְשָׁעִים, יִרְבֶּה-פָּשַׁע;    וְצַדִּיקִים, בְּמַפַּלְתָּם יִרְאוּ.
16.english: When the wicked are increased, transgression increaseth; but the righteous shall gaze upon their fall.

17.hebrew: יַסֵּר בִּנְךָ, וִינִיחֶךָ;    וְיִתֵּן מַעֲדַנִּים לְנַפְשֶׁךָ.
17.english: Correct thy son, and he will give thee rest; yea, he will give delight unto thy soul. {P}

18.hebrew: בְּאֵין חָזוֹן, יִפָּרַע עָם;    וְשֹׁמֵר תּוֹרָה אַשְׁרֵהוּ.
18.english: Where there is no vision, the people cast off restraint; but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

19.hebrew: בִּדְבָרִים, לֹא-יִוָּסֶר עָבֶד:    כִּי-יָבִין, וְאֵין מַעֲנֶה.
19.english: A servant will not be corrected by words; for though he understand, there will be no response.

20.hebrew: חָזִיתָ--אִישׁ, אָץ בִּדְבָרָיו:    תִּקְוָה לִכְסִיל מִמֶּנּוּ.
20.english: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope for a fool than for him.

21.hebrew: מְפַנֵּק מִנֹּעַר עַבְדּוֹ;    וְאַחֲרִיתוֹ, יִהְיֶה מָנוֹן.
21.english: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become master at the last.

22.hebrew: אִישׁ-אַף, יְגָרֶה מָדוֹן;    וּבַעַל חֵמָה רַב-פָּשַׁע.
22.english: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a wrathful man aboundeth in transgression.

23.hebrew: גַּאֲוַת אָדָם, תַּשְׁפִּילֶנּוּ;    וּשְׁפַל-רוּחַ, יִתְמֹךְ כָּבוֹד.
23.english: A man's pride shall bring him low; but he that is of a lowly spirit shall attain to honour.

24.hebrew: חוֹלֵק עִם-גַּנָּב, שׂוֹנֵא נַפְשׁוֹ;    אָלָה יִשְׁמַע, וְלֹא יַגִּיד.
24.english: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth the adjuration and uttereth nothing.

25.hebrew: חֶרְדַּת אָדָם, יִתֵּן מוֹקֵשׁ;    וּבוֹטֵחַ בַּיהוָה יְשֻׂגָּב.
25.english: The fear of man bringeth a snare; but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be set up on high.

26.hebrew: רַבִּים, מְבַקְשִׁים פְּנֵי-מוֹשֵׁל;    וּמֵיְהוָה, מִשְׁפַּט-אִישׁ.
26.english: Many seek the ruler's favour; but a man's judgment cometh from the LORD.

27.hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַת צַדִּיקִים, אִישׁ עָוֶל;    וְתוֹעֲבַת רָשָׁע יְשַׁר-דָּרֶךְ.
27.english: An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous; and he that is upright in the way is an abomination to the wicked. {P}

1.hebrew: דִּבְרֵי, אָגוּר בִּן-יָקֶה--הַמַּשָּׂא:    נְאֻם הַגֶּבֶר, לְאִיתִיאֵל; לְאִיתִיאֵל וְאֻכָל.
1.english: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh; the burden. The man saith unto Ithiel, unto Ithiel and Ucal:

2.hebrew: כִּי בַעַר אָנֹכִי מֵאִישׁ;    וְלֹא-בִינַת אָדָם לִי.
2.english: Surely I am brutish, unlike a man, and have not the understanding of a man;

3.hebrew: וְלֹא-לָמַדְתִּי חָכְמָה;    וְדַעַת קְדֹשִׁים אֵדָע.
3.english: And I have not learned wisdom, that I should have the knowledge of the Holy One.

4.hebrew: מִי עָלָה-שָׁמַיִם    וַיֵּרַד,מִי אָסַף-רוּחַ בְּחָפְנָיו    מִי צָרַר-מַיִם בַּשִּׂמְלָה--מִי,    הֵקִים כָּל-אַפְסֵי-אָרֶץ:מַה-שְּׁמוֹ וּמַה-שֶּׁם-בְּנוֹ,    כִּי תֵדָע.
4.english: Who hath ascended up into heaven, and descended? {N}Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound the waters in his garment? {N}Who hath established all the ends of the earth? {N}What is his name, and what is his son's name, if thou knowest?

5.hebrew: כָּל-אִמְרַת אֱלוֹהַּ צְרוּפָה;    מָגֵן הוּא, לַחֹסִים בּוֹ.
5.english: Every word of God is tried; He is a shield unto them that take refuge in Him.

6.hebrew: אַל-תּוֹסְףְּ עַל-דְּבָרָיו:    פֶּן-יוֹכִיחַ בְּךָ וְנִכְזָבְתָּ.
6.english: Add thou not unto His words, lest He reprove thee, and thou be found a liar. {P}

7.hebrew: שְׁתַּיִם, שָׁאַלְתִּי מֵאִתָּךְ;    אַל-תִּמְנַע מִמֶּנִּי, בְּטֶרֶם אָמוּת.
7.english: Two things have I asked of Thee; deny me them not before I die:

8.hebrew: שָׁוְא וּדְבַר-כָּזָב, הַרְחֵק מִמֶּנִּי--    רֵאשׁ וָעֹשֶׁר, אַל-תִּתֶּן-לִי;הַטְרִיפֵנִי,    לֶחֶם חֻקִּי.
8.english: Remove far from me falsehood and lies; give me neither poverty nor riches; {N}feed me with mine allotted bread;

9.hebrew: פֶּן אֶשְׂבַּע, וְכִחַשְׁתִּי--    וְאָמַרְתִּי, מִי יְהוָה:וּפֶן-אִוָּרֵשׁ וְגָנַבְתִּי;    וְתָפַשְׂתִּי, שֵׁם אֱלֹהָי.
9.english: Lest I be full, and deny, and say: 'Who is the LORD?' {N}Or lest I be poor, and steal, and profane the name of my God. {P}

10.hebrew: אַל-תַּלְשֵׁן עֶבֶד, אֶל-אֲדֹנָו:    פֶּן-יְקַלֶּלְךָ וְאָשָׁמְתָּ.
10.english: Slander not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

11.hebrew: דּוֹר, אָבִיו יְקַלֵּל;    וְאֶת-אִמּוֹ, לֹא יְבָרֵךְ.
11.english: There is a generation that curse their father, and do not bless their mother.

12.hebrew: דּוֹר, טָהוֹר בְּעֵינָיו;    וּמִצֹּאָתוֹ, לֹא רֻחָץ.
12.english: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet are not washed from their filthiness.

13.hebrew: דּוֹר, מָה-רָמוּ עֵינָיו;    וְעַפְעַפָּיו, יִנָּשֵׂאוּ.
13.english: There is a generation, Oh how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

14.hebrew: דּוֹר, חֲרָבוֹת שִׁנָּיו--    וּמַאֲכָלוֹת מְתַלְּעֹתָיו:לֶאֱכֹל עֲנִיִּים מֵאֶרֶץ;    וְאֶבְיוֹנִים, מֵאָדָם.
14.english: There is a generation whose teeth are as swords, and their great teeth as knives, {N}to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.

15.hebrew: לַעֲלוּקָה, שְׁתֵּי בָנוֹת--    הַב הַב:שָׁלוֹשׁ הֵנָּה, לֹא תִשְׂבַּעְנָה;    אַרְבַּע, לֹא-אָמְרוּ הוֹן.
15.english: The horseleech hath two daughters: 'Give, give.' {N}There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four that say not: 'Enough':

16.hebrew: שְׁאוֹל, וְעֹצֶר-רָחַם:    אֶרֶץ, לֹא-שָׂבְעָה מַּיִם; וְאֵשׁ, לֹא-אָמְרָה הוֹן.
16.english: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not satisfied with water; and the fire that saith not: 'Enough.'

17.hebrew: עַיִן, תִּלְעַג לְאָב--    וְתָבֻז לִיקְּהַת-אֵם:יִקְּרוּהָ, עֹרְבֵי-נַחַל;    וְיֹאכְלוּהָ בְנֵי-נָשֶׁר.
17.english: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, {N}the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young vultures shall eat it. {P}

18.hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁה הֵמָּה, נִפְלְאוּ מִמֶּנִּי;    וארבע (וְאַרְבָּעָה), לֹא יְדַעְתִּים.
18.english: There are three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

19.hebrew: דֶּרֶךְ הַנֶּשֶׁר, בַּשָּׁמַיִם--    דֶּרֶךְ נָחָשׁ, עֲלֵי-צוּר;דֶּרֶךְ-אֳנִיָּה בְלֶב-יָם--    וְדֶרֶךְ גֶּבֶר בְּעַלְמָה.
19.english: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; {N}the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a young woman.

20.hebrew: כֵּן, דֶּרֶךְ אִשָּׁה--    מְנָאָפֶת:אָכְלָה, וּמָחֲתָה פִיהָ;    וְאָמְרָה, לֹא-פָעַלְתִּי אָוֶן.
20.english: So is the way of an adulterous woman; {N}she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith: 'I have done no wickedness.' {P}

21.hebrew: תַּחַת שָׁלוֹשׁ, רָגְזָה אֶרֶץ;    וְתַחַת אַרְבַּע, לֹא-תוּכַל שְׂאֵת.
21.english: For three things the earth doth quake, and for four it cannot endure:

22.hebrew: תַּחַת-עֶבֶד, כִּי יִמְלוֹךְ;    וְנָבָל, כִּי יִשְׂבַּע-לָחֶם.
22.english: For a servant when he reigneth; and a churl when he is filled with food;

23.hebrew: תַּחַת שְׂנוּאָה, כִּי תִבָּעֵל;    וְשִׁפְחָה, כִּי תִירַשׁ גְּבִרְתָּהּ.
23.english: For an odious woman when she is married; and a handmaid that is heir to her mistress. {P}

24.hebrew: אַרְבָּעָה הֵם, קְטַנֵּי-אָרֶץ;    וְהֵמָּה, חֲכָמִים מְחֻכָּמִים.
24.english: There are four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:

25.hebrew: הַנְּמָלִים, עַם לֹא-עָז;    וַיָּכִינוּ בַקַּיִץ לַחְמָם.
25.english: The ants are a people not strong, yet they provide their food in the summer;

26.hebrew: שְׁפַנִּים, עַם לֹא-עָצוּם;    וַיָּשִׂימוּ בַסֶּלַע בֵּיתָם.
26.english: The rock-badgers are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the crags;

27.hebrew: מֶלֶךְ, אֵין לָאַרְבֶּה;    וַיֵּצֵא חֹצֵץ כֻּלּוֹ.
27.english: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

28.hebrew: שְׂמָמִית, בְּיָדַיִם תְּתַפֵּשׂ;    וְהִיא, בְּהֵיכְלֵי מֶלֶךְ.
28.english: The spider thou canst take with the hands, yet is she in kings' palaces. {P}

29.hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁה הֵמָּה, מֵיטִיבֵי צָעַד;    וְאַרְבָּעָה, מֵיטִבֵי לָכֶת.
29.english: There are three things which are stately in their march, yea, four which are stately in going:

30.english: The lion, which is mightiest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

31.hebrew: זַרְזִיר מָתְנַיִם אוֹ-תָיִשׁ;    וּמֶלֶךְ, אַלְקוּם עִמּוֹ.
31.english: The greyhound; the he-goat also; and the king, against whom there is no rising up.

32.english: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast planned devices, lay thy hand upon thy mouth.

33.hebrew: כִּי מִיץ חָלָב, יוֹצִיא חֶמְאָה--    וּמִיץ-אַף, יוֹצִיא דָם;וּמִיץ אַפַּיִם,    יוֹצִיא רִיב.
33.english: For the churning of milk bringeth forth curd, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood; {N}so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife. {P}

1.hebrew: דִּבְרֵי, לְמוּאֵל מֶלֶךְ--    מַשָּׂא, אֲשֶׁר-יִסְּרַתּוּ אִמּוֹ.
1.english: The words of king Lemuel; the burden wherewith his mother corrected him.

2.hebrew: מַה-בְּרִי, וּמַה-בַּר-בִּטְנִי;    וּמֶה, בַּר-נְדָרָי.
2.english: What, my son? and what, O son of my womb? and what, O son of my vows?

3.hebrew: אַל-תִּתֵּן לַנָּשִׁים חֵילֶךָ;    וּדְרָכֶיךָ, לַמְחוֹת מְלָכִין.
3.english: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

4.hebrew: אַל לַמְלָכִים, לְמוֹאֵל--אַל לַמְלָכִים שְׁתוֹ-יָיִן;    וּלְרוֹזְנִים, או (אֵי) שֵׁכָר.
4.english: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine: nor for princes to say: 'Where is strong drink?'

5.hebrew: פֶּן-יִשְׁתֶּה, וְיִשְׁכַּח מְחֻקָּק;    וִישַׁנֶּה, דִּין כָּל-בְּנֵי-עֹנִי.
5.english: Lest they drink, and forget that which is decreed, and pervert the justice due to any that is afflicted.

6.hebrew: תְּנוּ-שֵׁכָר לְאוֹבֵד;    וְיַיִן, לְמָרֵי נָפֶשׁ.
6.english: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto the bitter in soul;

7.hebrew: יִשְׁתֶּה, וְיִשְׁכַּח רִישׁוֹ;    וַעֲמָלוֹ, לֹא יִזְכָּר-עוֹד.
7.english: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more. {P}

8.hebrew: פְּתַח-פִּיךָ לְאִלֵּם;    אֶל-דִּין, כָּל-בְּנֵי חֲלוֹף.
8.english: Open thy mouth for the dumb, in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

9.hebrew: פְּתַח-פִּיךָ שְׁפָט-צֶדֶק;    וְדִין, עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן.
9.english: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy. {P}

10.hebrew: אֵשֶׁת-חַיִל, מִי יִמְצָא;    וְרָחֹק מִפְּנִינִים מִכְרָהּ.
10.english: A woman of valour who can find? for her price is far above rubies.

11.hebrew: בָּטַח בָּהּ, לֵב בַּעְלָהּ;    וְשָׁלָל, לֹא יֶחְסָר.
11.english: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, and he hath no lack of gain.

12.hebrew: גְּמָלַתְהוּ טוֹב וְלֹא-רָע--    כֹּל, יְמֵי חַיֶּיהָ.
12.english: She doeth him good and not evil all the days of her life.

13.hebrew: דָּרְשָׁה, צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים;    וַתַּעַשׂ, בְּחֵפֶץ כַּפֶּיהָ.
13.english: She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

14.hebrew: הָיְתָה, כָּאֳנִיּוֹת סוֹחֵר;    מִמֶּרְחָק, תָּבִיא לַחְמָהּ.
14.english: She is like the merchant-ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

15.hebrew: וַתָּקָם, בְּעוֹד לַיְלָה--וַתִּתֵּן טֶרֶף לְבֵיתָהּ;    וְחֹק, לְנַעֲרֹתֶיהָ.
15.english: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth food to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

16.hebrew: זָמְמָה שָׂדֶה, וַתִּקָּחֵהוּ;    מִפְּרִי כַפֶּיהָ, נטע (נָטְעָה) כָּרֶם.
16.english: She considereth a field, and buyeth it; with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

17.hebrew: חָגְרָה בְעוֹז מָתְנֶיהָ;    וַתְּאַמֵּץ, זְרוֹעֹתֶיהָ.
17.english: She girdeth her loins with strength, and maketh strong her arms.

18.hebrew: טָעֲמָה, כִּי-טוֹב סַחְרָהּ;    לֹא-יִכְבֶּה בליל (בַלַּיְלָה) נֵרָהּ.
18.english: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good; her lamp goeth not out by night.

19.hebrew: יָדֶיהָ, שִׁלְּחָה בַכִּישׁוֹר;    וְכַפֶּיהָ, תָּמְכוּ פָלֶךְ.
19.english: She layeth her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.

20.hebrew: כַּפָּהּ, פָּרְשָׂה לֶעָנִי;    וְיָדֶיהָ, שִׁלְּחָה לָאֶבְיוֹן.
20.english: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

21.hebrew: לֹא-תִירָא לְבֵיתָהּ מִשָּׁלֶג:    כִּי כָל-בֵּיתָהּ, לָבֻשׁ שָׁנִים.
21.english: She is not afraid of the snow for her household; for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

22.hebrew: מַרְבַדִּים עָשְׂתָה-לָּהּ;    שֵׁשׁ וְאַרְגָּמָן לְבוּשָׁהּ.
22.english: She maketh for herself coverlets; her clothing is fine linen and purple.

23.hebrew: נוֹדָע בַּשְּׁעָרִים בַּעְלָהּ;    בְּשִׁבְתּוֹ, עִם-זִקְנֵי-אָרֶץ.
23.english: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

24.hebrew: סָדִין עָשְׂתָה, וַתִּמְכֹּר;    וַחֲגוֹר, נָתְנָה לַכְּנַעֲנִי.
24.english: She maketh linen garments and selleth them; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

25.hebrew: עֹז-וְהָדָר לְבוּשָׁהּ;    וַתִּשְׂחַק, לְיוֹם אַחֲרוֹן.
25.english: Strength and dignity are her clothing; and she laugheth at the time to come.

26.hebrew: פִּיהָ, פָּתְחָה בְחָכְמָה;    וְתוֹרַת חֶסֶד, עַל-לְשׁוֹנָהּ.
26.english: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and the law of kindness is on her tongue.

27.hebrew: צוֹפִיָּה, הילכות (הֲלִיכוֹת) בֵּיתָהּ;    וְלֶחֶם עַצְלוּת, לֹא תֹאכֵל.
27.english: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

28.hebrew: קָמוּ בָנֶיהָ, וַיְאַשְּׁרוּהָ;    בַּעְלָהּ, וַיְהַלְלָהּ.
28.english: Her children rise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her:

29.hebrew: רַבּוֹת בָּנוֹת, עָשׂוּ חָיִל;    וְאַתְּ, עָלִית עַל-כֻּלָּנָה.
29.english: 'Many daughters have done valiantly, but thou excellest them all.'

30.hebrew: שֶׁקֶר הַחֵן, וְהֶבֶל הַיֹּפִי:    אִשָּׁה יִרְאַת-יְהוָה, הִיא תִתְהַלָּל.
30.english: Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain; but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.

31.hebrew: תְּנוּ-לָהּ, מִפְּרִי יָדֶיהָ;    וִיהַלְלוּהָ בַשְּׁעָרִים מַעֲשֶׂיהָ.  {ש}
31.english: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her works praise her in the gates. {P}

1.hebrew: מִשְׁלֵי, שְׁלֹמֹה בֶן-דָּוִד--    מֶלֶךְ, יִשְׂרָאֵל.
1.english: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

2.hebrew: לָדַעַת חָכְמָה וּמוּסָר;    לְהָבִין, אִמְרֵי בִינָה.
2.english: To know wisdom and instruction; to comprehend the words of understanding;

3.hebrew: לָקַחַת, מוּסַר הַשְׂכֵּל;    צֶדֶק וּמִשְׁפָּט, וּמֵשָׁרִים.
3.english: To receive the discipline of wisdom, justice, and right, and equity;

4.hebrew: לָתֵת לִפְתָאיִם עָרְמָה;    לְנַעַר, דַּעַת וּמְזִמָּה.
4.english: To give prudence to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion;

5.hebrew: יִשְׁמַע חָכָם, וְיוֹסֶף לֶקַח;    וְנָבוֹן, תַּחְבֻּלוֹת יִקְנֶה.
5.english: That the wise man may hear, and increase in learning, and the man of understanding may attain unto wise counsels;

6.hebrew: לְהָבִין מָשָׁל, וּמְלִיצָה;    דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, וְחִידֹתָם.
6.english: To understand a proverb, and a figure; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

7.hebrew: יִרְאַת יְהוָה, רֵאשִׁית דָּעַת;    חָכְמָה וּמוּסָר, אֱוִילִים בָּזוּ.
7.english: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; but the foolish despise wisdom and discipline. {P}

8.hebrew: שְׁמַע בְּנִי, מוּסַר אָבִיךָ;    וְאַל-תִּטֹּשׁ, תּוֹרַת אִמֶּךָ.
8.english: Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;

9.hebrew: כִּי, לִוְיַת חֵן הֵם לְרֹאשֶׁךָ;    וַעֲנָקִים, לְגַרְגְּרֹתֶךָ.
9.english: For they shall be a chaplet of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

10.hebrew: בְּנִי--    אִם-יְפַתּוּךָ חַטָּאִים, אַל-תֹּבֵא.
10.english: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

11.hebrew: אִם-יֹאמְרוּ,    לְכָה אִתָּנוּ:נֶאֶרְבָה לְדָם;    נִצְפְּנָה לְנָקִי חִנָּם.
11.english: If they say: 'Come with us, {N}let us lie in wait for blood, let us lurk for the innocent without cause;

12.hebrew: נִבְלָעֵם, כִּשְׁאוֹל חַיִּים;    וּתְמִימִים, כְּיוֹרְדֵי בוֹר.
12.english: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave, and whole, as those that go down into the pit;

13.hebrew: כָּל-הוֹן יָקָר נִמְצָא;    נְמַלֵּא בָתֵּינוּ שָׁלָל.
13.english: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil;

14.hebrew: גּוֹרָלְךָ, תַּפִּיל בְּתוֹכֵנוּ;    כִּיס אֶחָד, יִהְיֶה לְכֻלָּנוּ.
14.english: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse'--

15.hebrew: בְּנִי--אַל-תֵּלֵךְ בְּדֶרֶךְ אִתָּם;    מְנַע רַגְלְךָ, מִנְּתִיבָתָם.
15.english: My son, walk not thou in the way with them, restrain thy foot from their path;

16.hebrew: כִּי רַגְלֵיהֶם, לָרַע יָרוּצוּ;    וִימַהֲרוּ, לִשְׁפָּךְ-דָּם.
16.english: For their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.

17.hebrew: כִּי-חִנָּם, מְזֹרָה הָרָשֶׁת--    בְּעֵינֵי, כָּל-בַּעַל כָּנָף.
17.english: For in vain the net is spread in the eyes of any bird;

18.hebrew: וְהֵם, לְדָמָם יֶאֱרֹבוּ;    יִצְפְּנוּ, לְנַפְשֹׁתָם.
18.english: And these lie in wait for their own blood, they lurk for their own lives.

19.hebrew: כֵּן--אָרְחוֹת, כָּל-בֹּצֵעַ בָּצַע;    אֶת-נֶפֶשׁ בְּעָלָיו יִקָּח.
19.english: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; it taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

20.hebrew: חָכְמוֹת, בַּחוּץ תָּרֹנָּה;    בָּרְחֹבוֹת, תִּתֵּן קוֹלָהּ.
20.english: Wisdom crieth aloud in the streets, she uttereth her voice in the broad places;

21.hebrew: בְּרֹאשׁ הֹמִיּוֹת, תִּקְרָא:    בְּפִתְחֵי שְׁעָרִים בָּעִיר--אֲמָרֶיהָ תֹאמֵר.
21.english: She calleth at the head of the noisy streets, at the entrances of the gates, in the city, she uttereth her words:

22.hebrew: עַד-מָתַי, פְּתָיִם--    תְּאֵהֲבוּ-פֶתִי:וְלֵצִים--לָצוֹן, חָמְדוּ לָהֶם;    וּכְסִילִים, יִשְׂנְאוּ-דָעַת.
22.english: 'How long, ye thoughtless, will ye love thoughtlessness? {N}And how long will scorners delight them in scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

23.hebrew: תָּשׁוּבוּ, לְתוֹכַחְתִּי:    הִנֵּה אַבִּיעָה לָכֶם רוּחִי; אוֹדִיעָה דְבָרַי אֶתְכֶם.
23.english: Turn you at my reproof; behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

24.hebrew: יַעַן קָרָאתִי, וַתְּמָאֵנוּ;    נָטִיתִי יָדִי, וְאֵין מַקְשִׁיב.
24.english: Because I have called, and ye refused, I have stretched out my hand, and no man attended,

25.hebrew: וַתִּפְרְעוּ כָל-עֲצָתִי;    וְתוֹכַחְתִּי, לֹא אֲבִיתֶם.
25.english: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof;

26.hebrew: גַּם-אֲנִי, בְּאֵידְכֶם אֶשְׂחָק;    אֶלְעַג, בְּבֹא פַחְדְּכֶם.
26.english: I also, in your calamity, will laugh, I will mock when your dread cometh;

27.hebrew: בְּבֹא כשאוה (כְשׁוֹאָה), פַּחְדְּכֶם--    וְאֵידְכֶם, כְּסוּפָה יֶאֱתֶה;בְּבֹא עֲלֵיכֶם,    צָרָה וְצוּקָה.
27.english: When your dread cometh as a storm, and your calamity cometh on as a whirlwind; {N}when trouble and distress come upon you.

28.hebrew: אָז יִקְרָאֻנְנִי, וְלֹא אֶעֱנֶה;    יְשַׁחֲרֻנְנִי, וְלֹא יִמְצָאֻנְנִי.
28.english: Then will they call me, but I will not answer, they will seek me earnestly, but they shall not find me.

29.hebrew: תַּחַת, כִּי-שָׂנְאוּ דָעַת;    וְיִרְאַת יְהוָה, לֹא בָחָרוּ.
29.english: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD;

30.english: They would none of my counsel, they despised all my reproof.

31.english: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

32.hebrew: כִּי מְשׁוּבַת פְּתָיִם תַּהַרְגֵם;    וְשַׁלְוַת כְּסִילִים תְּאַבְּדֵם.
32.english: For the waywardness of the thoughtless shall slay them, and the confidence of fools shall destroy them.

33.hebrew: וְשֹׁמֵעַ לִי, יִשְׁכָּן-בֶּטַח;    וְשַׁאֲנַן, מִפַּחַד רָעָה.
33.english: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell securely, and shall be quiet without fear of evil.' {P}
